titleStmt.title: Dictionary of Greek Words taken from Strong's Exhaustive Concordance

body.entryFree: *A Α A al'-fah of Hebrew origin; the first letter of the alphabet; figuratively, only (from its use as a numeral) the first: --Alpha. Often used (usually ἄν án, , before a vowel) also in composition (as a contraction from 427) in the sense of privation; so, in many words, beginning with this letter; occasionally in the sense of union (as a contraction of 260).

entryFree.def: Aaron, the brother of Moses:--Aaron.
a destroying angel:--Abaddon.
weightless, i.e. (figuratively) not burdensome:--from being burdensome.
father as a vocative:--Abba.
Abel, the son of Adam:--Abel.
Abijah, the name of two Israelites:--Abia.
Abiathar, an Israelite:--Abiathar.
Abilene, a region of Syria:--Abilene.
Abihud, an Israelite:--Abiud.

body.entryFree: Ἀβραάμ Abraám, ab-rah-am' of Hebrew origin [085]; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch:--Abraham. (In Acts 7:16 the text should probably read Jacob.)

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a variation of 1037;
entryFree.def: depthless, i.e. (specially) (infernal) "abyss":--deep, (bottomless) pit.
Agabus, an Israelite:--Agabus.
to work good:--do good.
to be a well-doer (as a favor or a duty):--(when) do good (well).
well-doing, i.e. virtue:--well-doing.
a well-doer, i.e. virtuous:--them that do well.

body.entryFree: ἀγαθός agathós, ag-ath-os' a primary word; "good" (in any sense, often as noun):--benefit, good(-s, things), well. Compare 2570.

entryFree.def: goodness, i.e. virtue or beneficence:--goodness.
exultation; specially, welcome:--gladness, (exceeding) joy.
unmarried:--unmarried.
indignation:--indignation.

body.entryFree: A)GAPA/W ἀγαπάω agapáō ag-ap-ah'-o perhaps from ἄγαν ágan, (much) [or compare 5689]; to love (in a social or moral sense):--(be-)love(-ed). Compare 5368.

entryFree.def: love, i.e. affection or benevolence; specially (plural) a love-feast:--(feast of) charity(-ably), dear, love.
beloved:--(dearly, well) beloved, dear.
Hagar, the concubine of Abraham:--Hagar.
properly, to be a courier, i.e. (by implication) to press into public service:--compel (to go).
an announcement, i.e. (by implication) precept:--message.
properly, lead, i.e. come on:--go to.
a drove:--herd.
unregistered as to birth:--without descent.
properly, without kin, i.e. (of unknown descent, and by implication) ignoble:--base things.
to make holy, i.e. (ceremonially) purify or consecrate; (mentally) to venerate:--hallow, be holy, sanctify.
properly, purification, i.e. (the state) purity; concretely (by Hebraism) a purifier:--holiness, sanctification.
a sacred thing (i.e. spot):--holiest (of all), holy place, sanctuary.
sanctity (i.e. properly, the state):--holiness.
sacredness (i.e. properly, the quality):--holiness.
a hook (as bent):--hook.
an "anchor" (as crooked):--anchor.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and the same as 1102;
entryFree.def: properly, unfulled, i.e. (by implication) new (cloth):--new.
cleanliness (the quality), i.e. (specially) chastity:--purity.
to make clean, i.e. (figuratively) sanctify (ceremonially or morally):--purify (self).
a cleansing (the act), i.e. (ceremonially) lustration:--purification.
not to know (through lack of information or intelligence); by implication, to ignore (through disinclination):--(be) ignorant(-ly), not know, not understand, unknown.
a thing ignored, i.e. shortcoming:--error.
ignorance (properly, the quality):--ignorance.
properly, clean, i.e. (figuratively) innocent, modest, perfect:--chaste, clean, pure.
cleanness (the state), i.e. (figuratively) blamelessness:--pureness.
purely, i.e. honestly:--sincerely.
ignorance (properly, the state):--ignorance, not the knowledge.
unknown:--unknown.
properly, to go to market, i.e. (by implication) to purchase; specially, to redeem:--buy, redeem.
relating to the market-place, i.e. forensic (times); by implication, vulgar:--baser sort, low.
(abstractly) a catching (of fish); also (concretely) a haul (of fish):--draught.
unlettered, i.e. illiterate:--unlearned.
to camp out:--abide in the field.
to hunt, i.e. (figuratively) to entrap:--catch.
an oleaster:--olive tree (which is) wild.
wild (as pertaining to the country), literally (natural) or figuratively (fierce):--wild, raging.
wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods:--Agrippa.
a field (as a drive for cattle); genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. hamlet:--country, farm, piece of ground, land.
to be sleepless, i.e. keep awake:--watch.
sleeplessness, i.e. a keeping awake:--watch.
properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, (reflexively) go, (specially) pass (time), or (figuratively) induce:--be, bring (forth), carry, (let) go, keep, lead away, be open.
a bringing up, i.e. mode of living:--manner of life.
properly, a place of assembly (as if led), i.e. (by implication) a contest (held there); figuratively, an effort or anxiety:--conflict, contention, fight, race.
a struggle (properly, the state), i.e. (figuratively) anguish:--agony.
to struggle, literally (to compete for a prize), figuratively (to contend with an adversary), or genitive case (to endeavor to accomplish something):--fight, labor fervently, strive.
Adam, the first man; typically (of Jesus) man (as his representative):--Adam.
and 1160; costless, i.e. gratuitous:--without expense.
Addi, an Israelite:--Addi.
a sister (naturally or ecclesiastically):--sister.
brotherhood (properly, the feeling of brotherliness), i.e. the (Christian) fraternity:--brethren, brotherhood.
hidden, figuratively, indistinct:--appear not, uncertain.
uncertainty:--X uncertain.
uncertainly:--uncertainly.
properly, unseen, i.e. "Hades" or the place (state) of departed souls:--grave, hell.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 1252;
entryFree.def: properly, undistinguished, i.e. (actively) impartial:--without partiality.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of a compound of 1223 and 3007;
entryFree.def: unintermitted, i.e. permanent:--without ceasing, continual.
uninterruptedly, i.e. without omission (on an appropriate occasion):--without ceasing.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 1311;
entryFree.def: incorruptibleness, i.e. (figuratively) purity (of doctrine):--uncorruptness.
to be unjust, i.e. (actively) do wrong (morally, socially or physically):--hurt, injure, be an offender, be unjust, (do, suffer, take) wrong.
a wrong done:--evil doing, iniquity, matter of wrong.
(legal) injustice (properly, the quality, by implication, the act); morally, wrongfulness (of character, life or act):--iniquity, unjust, unrighteousness, wrong.
unjust; by extension wicked; by implication, treacherous; specially, heathen:--unjust, unrighteous.
unjustly:--wrongfully.
unapproved, i.e. rejected; by implication, worthless (literally or morally):--castaway, rejected, reprobate.
and 1388; undeceitful, i.e. (figuratively) unadulterated:--sincere.
to be unable, i.e. (passively) impossible:--be impossible.
unable, i.e. weak (literally or figuratively); passively, impossible:--could not do, impossible, impotent, not possible, weak.
to sing:--sing.

entryFree.etym: from an obsolete primary noun (apparently meaning continued duration);
entryFree.def: "ever," by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly:--always, ever.
an eagle (from its wind-like flight):--eagle.
unleavened, i.e. (figuratively) uncorrupted; (in the neutral plural) specially (by implication) the Passover week:--unleavened (bread).
Azor, an Israelite:--Azor.
Azotus (i.e. Ashdod), a place in Palestine:--Azotus.

body.entryFree: A)H/R ἀήρ aḗr ah-ayr' from ἄημι áēmi, (to breathe unconsciously, i.e. respire; by analogy, to blow); "air" (as naturally circumambient):--air. Compare 5594.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and 2288;
entryFree.def: deathlessness:--immortality.
godless:--without God.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 5087 (in the sense of enacting);
entryFree.def: lawless, i.e. (by implication) criminal:--wicked.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 5087;
entryFree.def: to set aside, i.e. (by implication) to disesteem, neutralize or violate:--cast off, despise, disannul, frustrate, bring to nought, reject.
cancellation (literally or figuratively):--disannulling, put away.
an Athenæan or inhabitant of Athenæ:--Athenian.
a struggle (figuratively):--fight.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and 2372;
entryFree.def: to be spiritless, i.e. disheartened:--be dismayed.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and probably a derivative of 5087 (meaning a penalty);
entryFree.def: not guilty:--innocent.
an Ægyptian or inhabitant of Ægyptus:--Egyptian.
Ægyptus, the land of the Nile:--Egypt.
everduring (forward and backward, or forward only):--eternal, everlasting.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from 1 (as a negative particle) and 1492 (through the idea of downcast eyes);
entryFree.def: bashfulness, i.e. (towards men), modesty or (towards God) awe:--reverence, shamefacedness.
blood, literally (of men or animals), figuratively (the juice of grapes) or specially (the atoning blood of Christ); by implication, bloodshed, also kindred:--blood.
an effusion of blood:--shedding of blood.
to flow blood, i.e. have a hæmorrhage:--diseased with an issue of blood.
Ænĕas, an Israelite:--Æneas.
a praising (the act), i.e. (specially) a thank(-offering):--praise.
to praise (God):--praise.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of 136 (in its primary sense);
entryFree.def: an obscure saying ("enigma"), i.e. (abstractly) obscureness:--X darkly.
properly, a story, but used in the sense of 1868; praise (of God):--praise.

entryFree.etym: of Hebrew origin [a derivative of 5869, place of springs];
entryFree.def: Ænon, a place in Palestine:--Ænon.

body.entryFree: AI(RE/OMAI αἱρέομαι hairéomai hahee-reh'-om-ahee probably akin to 142; to take for oneself, i.e. to prefer:--choose. Some of the forms are borrowed from a cognate ἕλλομαι héllomai, hel'-lom-ahee; which is otherwise obsolete.

entryFree.def: properly, a choice, i.e. (specially) a party or (abstractly) disunion:--heresy (which is the Greek word itself), sect.
to make a choice:--choose.
a schismatic:--heretic (the Greek word itself).

to lift up; by implication, to take up or away; figuratively, to raise (the voice), keep in suspense (the mind), specially, to sail away (i.e. weigh anchor); by Hebraism [compare 05375] to expiate sin:--away with, bear (up), carry, lift up, loose, make to doubt, put away, remove, take (away, up).
to apprehend (properly, by the senses):--perceive.
perception, i.e. (figuratively) discernment:--judgment.
properly, an organ of perception, i.e. (figuratively) judgment:--senses.
sordidly:--for filthy lucre's sake.
vile conversation:--filthy communication.
a shameful thing, i.e. indecorum:--shame.
shameful, i.e. base (specially, venal):--filthy.
shamefulness, i.e. obscenity:--filthiness.
shame or disgrace (abstractly or concretely):--dishonesty, shame.

body.entryFree: αἰτέω aitéō, ahee-teh'-o of uncertain derivation; to ask (in genitive case):--ask, beg, call for, crave, desire, require. Compare 4441.

entryFree.def: a thing asked or (abstractly) an asking:--petition, request, required.
a cause (as if asked for), i.e. (logical) reason (motive, matter), (legal) crime (alleged or proved):--accusation, case, cause, crime, fault, (wh-)ere(-fore).
a thing charged:--complaint.
a reason or crime (like 156):--cause, fault.
causative, i.e. (concretely) a causer:--author.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and 5316 (compare 1810) (meaning non-apparent);
entryFree.def: unexpected, i.e. (adverbially) suddenly:--sudden, unawares.
captivity:--captivity.
to capture (like 163):--lead captive.
to make captive:--lead away captive, bring into captivity.

body.entryFree: αἰών aiṓn, ahee-ohn' from the same as 104; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity (also past); by implication, the world; specially (Jewish) a Messianic period (present or future):--age, course, eternal, (for) ever(-more), (n-)ever, (beginning of the , while the) world (began, without end). Compare 5550.

entryFree.def: perpetual (also used of past time, or past and future as well):--eternal, for ever, everlasting, world (began).
impurity (the quality), physically or morally:--uncleanness.
impurity (the state), morally:--filthiness.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 2508 (meaning cleansed);
entryFree.def: impure (ceremonially, morally (lewd) or specially, (demonic)):--foul, unclean.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and 2540 (meaning unseasonable);
entryFree.def: to be inopportune (for oneself), i.e. to fail of a proper occasion:--lack opportunity.
inopportunely:--out of season.
not bad, i.e. (objectively) innocent or (subjectively) unsuspecting:--harmless, simple.
a thorn:--thorn.
thorny:--of thorns.
barren (literally or figuratively):--without fruit, unfruitful.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2607;
entryFree.def: unblamable:--that cannot be condemned.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of a compound of 2596 and 2572;
entryFree.def: unveiled:--uncovered.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2632;
entryFree.def: without (legal) trial:--uncondemned.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2647;
entryFree.def: indissoluble, i.e. (figuratively) permanent:--endless.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2664;
entryFree.def: unrefraining:--that cannot cease.
instability, i.e. disorder:--commotion, confusion, tumult.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2525;
entryFree.def: inconstant:--unstable.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2722;
entryFree.def: unrestrainable:--unruly.

entryFree.etym: of Chaldee origin (meaning field of blood;
entryFree.def: corresponding to 02506 and 01818); Akeldama, a place near Jerusalem:--Aceldama.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 2767;
entryFree.def: unmixed, i.e. (figuratively) innocent:--harmless, simple.
not leaning, i.e. (figuratively) firm:--without wavering.
to make a point, i.e. (figuratively) mature:--be fully ripe.
hearing (the act, the sense or the thing heard):--audience, ear, fame, which ye heard, hearing, preached, report, rumor.
to hear (in various senses):--give (in the) audience (of), come (to the ears), (shall) hear(-er, -ken), be noised, be reported, understand.
want of self-restraint:--excess, incontinency.
powerless, i.e. without self-control:--incontinent.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 2767;
entryFree.def: undiluted:--without mixture.
exactness:--perfect manner.

entryFree.etym: neuter of the comparative of the same as 196;
entryFree.def: (adverbially) more exactly:--more perfect(-ly).
to be exact, i.e. ascertain:--enquire diligently.
exactly:--circumspectly, diligently, perfect(-ly).
a locust (as pointed, or as lighting on the top of vegetation):--locust.
an audience-room:--place of hearing.
belonging to the extreme corner:--chief corner.

entryFree.etym: neuter of an adjective probably akin to the base of 188;
entryFree.def: the extremity:--one end… other, tip, top, uttermost part.
Akulas, an Israelite:--Aquila.
to invalidate:--disannul, make of none effect.

entryFree.etym: adverb from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2967;
entryFree.def: in an unhindered manner, i.e. freely:--no man forbidding him.
unwilling:--against the will.
braggadocio, i.e. (by implication) self-confidence:--boasting, pride.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 2980;
entryFree.def: unspeakable:--unutterable, which cannot be uttered.
mute:--dumb.
salt; figuratively, prudence:--salt.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as particle of union) and the base of 3045;
entryFree.def: to oil (with perfume):--anoint.
cock-crow, i.e. the third night-watch:--cockcrowing.
Alexandrine, or belonging to Alexandria:--of Alexandria.

entryFree.etym: from the same as (the first part of) 220 and 435;
entryFree.def: man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man:--Alexander.
truth:--true, X truly, truth, verity.
to be true (in doctrine and profession):--speak (tell) the truth.
true (as not concealing):--true, truly, truth.
truthful:--true.
to grind:--grind.
truly:--indeed, surely, of a surety, truly, of a (in) truth, verily, very.
a sailor (as engaged on the salt water), i.e. (by implication) a fisher:--fisher(-man).
to be a fisher, i.e. (by implication) to fish:--go a-fishing.
to salt:--salt.
properly, other things, i.e. (adverbially) contrariwise (in many relations):--and, but (even), howbeit, indeed, nay, nevertheless, no, notwithstanding, save, therefore, yea, yet.
to make different:--change.
from elsewhere:--some other way.
praise ye Jah!, an adoring exclamation:--alleluiah.
one another:--each other, mutual, one another, (the other), (them-, your-)selves, (selves) together (sometimes with 3326 or 4314).
foreign, i.e. not a Jew:--stranger.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of apparently a primary verb;
entryFree.def: to jump; figuratively, to gush:--leap, spring up.
"else," i.e. different (in many applications):--more, one (another), (an-, some an-)other(-s, -wise).
overseeing others' affairs, i.e. a meddler (specially, in Gentile customs):--busybody in other men's matters.
another's, i.e. not one's own; by extension foreign, not akin, hostile:--alien, (an-)other (man's, men's), strange(-r).
foreign, i.e. (specially) Gentile:--one of another nation.
differently:--otherwise.
to tread out grain:--thresh, tread out the corn.
irrational:--brute, unreasonable.
aloes (the gum):--aloes.
"salt":--salt.
briny:--salt.

entryFree.etym: comparative of a compound of 1 (as a negative particle) and 3077;
entryFree.def: more without grief:--less sorrowful.
a fetter or manacle:--bonds, chain.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and the base of 3081;
entryFree.def: gainless, i.e. (by implication) pernicious:--unprofitable.
Alphæus, an Israelite:--Alpheus.
a threshing-floor (as rolled hard), i.e. (figuratively) the grain (and chaff, as just threshed):--floor.
a fox, i.e. (figuratively) a cunning person:--fox.
capture:--be taken.
properly, at the "same" time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association:--also, and, together, with(-al).
ignorant:--unlearned.
"amaranthine", i.e. (by implication) fadeless:--that fadeth not away.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 3133;
entryFree.def: unfading, i.e. (by implication) perpetual:--that fadeth not away.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from 1 (as a negative particle) and the base of 3313;
entryFree.def: properly, to miss the mark (and so not share in the prize), i.e. (figuratively) to err, especially (morally) to sin:--for your faults, offend, sin, trespass.
a sin (properly concrete):--sin.
a sin (properly abstract):--offence, sin(-ful).

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a form of 3144;
entryFree.def: unattested:--without witness.
sinful, i.e. a sinner:--sinful, sinner.
peaceable:--not a brawler.
properly, to collect, i.e. (by implication) reap:--reap down.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3184;
entryFree.def: the "amethyst" (supposed to prevent intoxication):--amethyst.
to be careless of:--make light of, neglect, be negligent, no regard.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3201;
entryFree.def: irreproachable:--blameless, faultless, unblamable.
faultlessly:--blameless, unblamably.
not anxious:--without care(-fulness), secure.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3346;
entryFree.def: unchangeable, or (neuter as abstract) unchangeability:--immutable(-ility).

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3334;
entryFree.def: immovable:--unmovable.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 3338;
entryFree.def: irrevocable:--without repentance, not to be repented of.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of 3340;
entryFree.def: unrepentant:--impenitent.
immoderate:--(thing) without measure.
properly, firm, i.e. (figuratively) trustworthy; adverbially, surely (often as interjection, so be it):--amen, verily.
motherless, i.e. of unknown maternity:--without mother.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3392;
entryFree.def: unsoiled, i.e. (figuratively) pure:--undefiled.
Aminadab, an Israelite:--Aminadab.
sand (as heaped on the beach):--sand.
a lamb:--lamb.

entryFree.etym: probably from the base of 297 and that of 257;
entryFree.def: a vine (as coiling about a support):--vine.
a vine-worker, i.e. pruner:--vine-dresser.
a vineyard:--vineyard.
Amplias, a Roman Christian:--Amplias.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of a primary verb;
entryFree.def: to ward off (for oneself), i.e. protect:--defend.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of the base of 297 and 906;
entryFree.def: a (fishing) net (as thrown about the fish):--net.
a city surrounded by a river; Amphipolis, a place in Macedonia:--Amphipolis.
a fork in the road:--where two ways meet.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and a derivative of 3469;
entryFree.def: unblamable:--blameless.
unblemished (literally or figuratively):--without blame (blemish, fault, spot), faultless, unblamable.
Amon, an Israelite:--Amon.
Amos, an Israelite:--Amos.

body.entryFree: ἄν án, an a primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty :--(what-, where-, wither-, who-)soever. Usually unexpressed except by the subjunctive or potential mood. Also contracted for 1437.

ἀνά aná, an-ah' a primary preposition and adverb; properly, up; but (by extension) used (distributively) severally, or (locally) at (etc.):--and, apiece, by, each, every (man), in, through. In compounds (as a prefix) it often means (by implication) repetition, intensity, reversal, etc.

entryFree.def: a stairway:--stairs.
to go up (literally or figuratively):--arise, ascend (up), climb (go, grow, rise, spring) up, come (up).
to put off (for oneself):--defer.

entryFree.etym: from 303 and a derivative of the base of 939;
entryFree.def: to cause to go up, i.e. haul (a net):--draw.
to look up; by implication, to recover sight:--look (up), see, receive sight.
restoration of sight:--recovery of sight.
to halloo:--cry (aloud, out).
a putting off:--delay.
to announce (in detail):--declare, rehearse, report, show, speak, tell.
to beget or (by extension) bear (again):--beget, (bear) X (again).
to know again, i.e. (by extension) to read:--read.
to necessitate:--compel, constrain.
necessary; by implication, close (of kin):--near, necessary, necessity, needful.
compulsorily:--by constraint.
constraint (literally or figuratively); by implication, distress:--distress, must needs, (of) necessity(-sary), needeth, needful.
to make (oneself) known:--be made known.
(the act of) reading:--reading.
to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away:--bring (again, forth, up again), depart, launch (forth), lead (up), loose, offer, sail, set forth, take up.
to exhibit, i.e. (by implication) to indicate, appoint:--appoint, shew.
(the act of) exhibition:--shewing.
to entertain (as a guest):--receive.
to hand over:--deliver.
to recover life (literally or figuratively):--(be a-)live again, revive.
to search out:--seek.
to gird afresh:--gird up.

entryFree.etym: from 303 and a compound of the base of 2226 and 4442;
entryFree.def: to re-enkindle:--stir up.
a (religious) ban or (concretely) excommunicated (thing or person):--accused, anathema, curse, X great.
to declare or vow under penalty of execration:--(bind under a) curse, bind with an oath.
to look again (i.e. attentively) at (literally or figuratively):--behold, consider.

entryFree.etym: from 394 (like 331, but in a good sense);
entryFree.def: a votive offering:--gift.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 1 (as a negative particle (compare 427)) and 127;
entryFree.def: impudence, i.e. (by implication) importunity:--importunity.
(the act of) killing:--death.
to take up, i.e. adopt; by implication, to take away (violently), i.e. abolish, murder:--put to death, kill, slay, take away, take up.

entryFree.etym: from 1 (as a negative particle) and 159 (in the sense of 156);
entryFree.def: innocent:--blameless, guiltless.
properly, to set up, i.e. (reflexively) to sit up:--sit up.
to restore:--renew.
to renovate:--renew.
renovation:--renewing.

entryFree.etym: a prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb;

sweet (i.e. not bitter nor salt):--sweet, fresh.

legitimate (of birth), i.e. genuine:--own, sincerity, true.

knowing (the act), i.e. (by implication) knowledge:--knowledge, science.
a knower:--expert.

body.entryFree: διά diá, dee-ah' a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). body.entryFree: διάδημα diádēma, dee-ad'-ay-mah from a compound of 1223 and 1210; a "diadem" (as bound about the head):--crown. Compare 4735.

judicial estimation:--discern(-ing), disputation.

entryFree.etym: from 1223 and the genitive case of 3956;

entryFree.etym: from 1223 and a derivative of the base of 4008;

to toil through, i.e. (passively) be worried:--be grieved.

a variation:--difference, distinction.

to save thoroughly, i.e. (by implication or analogy) to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.:--bring safe, escape (safe), heal, make perfectly whole, save.
arrangement, i.e. institution:--instrumentality.
an arrangement, i.e. (authoritative) edict:--commandment.
to disturb wholly, i.e. agitate (with alarm):--trouble.

to accomplish thoroughly, i.e. (subjectively) to persist:--continue.

through what cause ?, i.e. why?:--wherefore, why.

body.entryFree: εἰ ei, i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in 1489, 1490, 1499, 1508, 1509, 1512, 1513, 1536, 1537. See also 1437.

body.entryFree: εἰς eis, ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively).

body.entryFree: E)K ἐκ ek ek or ἐξ ex, ex a primary preposition denoting origin (the point whence action or motion proceeds), from, out (of place, time, or cause; literal or figurative; direct or remote):--after, among, X are, at, betwixt(-yond), by (the means of), exceedingly, (+ abundantly above), for(- th), from (among, forth, up), + grudgingly, + heartily, X heavenly, X hereby, + very highly, in, …ly, (because, by reason) of, off (from), on, out among (from, of), over, since, X thenceforth, through, X unto, X vehemently, with(-out). body.entryFree: ἐν en, en a primary preposition denoting (fixed) position (in place, time or state), and (by implication) instrumentality (medially or constructively), i.e. a relation of rest (intermediate between 1519 and 1537); "in," at, (up-)on, by, etc.:--about, after, against, + almost, X altogether, among, X as, at, before, between, (here-)by (+ all means), for (… sake of), + give self wholly to, (here-)in(-to, -wardly), X mightily, (because) of, (up-)on, (open-)ly, X outwardly, one, X quickly, X shortly, (speedi-)ly, X that, X there(-in, -on), through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), under, when, where(-with), while, with(-in). Often used in compounds, with substantially the same import; rarely with verbs of motion, and then not to indicate direction, except (elliptically) by a separate (and different) preposition.

body.entryFree: ἐπί epí, ep-ee' a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. body.entryFree: κατά katá, kat-ah' a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity.

to eat down, i.e. devour (literally or figuratively):--devour.
to straighten fully, i.e. (figuratively) direct:--guide, direct.
to stand over against, i.e. rush upon (assault):--make insurrection against.
to hold down (fast), in various applications (literally or figuratively):--have, hold (fast), keep (in memory), let, X make toward, possess, retain, seize on, stay, take, withhold.
to be a plaintiff, i.e. to charge with some offence:--accuse, object.
a complaint ("category"), i.e. criminal charge:--accusation (X -ed).
against one in the assembly, i.e. a complainant at law; specially, Satan:--accuser.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 2596 and perhaps a derivative of the base of 5316 (meaning downcast in look);
entryFree.def: demureness, i.e. (by implication) sadness:--heaviness.
to sound down into the ears, i.e. (by implication) to indoctrinate ("catechize") or (genitive case) to apprise of:--inform, instruct, teach.
to rust down, i.e. corrode:--canker.
to overpower:--prevail (against).
to house permanently, i.e. reside (literally or figuratively):--dwell(-er), inhabitant(-ter).
residence (properly, the act; but by implication, concretely, the mansion):--dwelling.
a dwelling-place:--habitation.
residence (properly, the condition; but by implication, the abode itself):--habitation.

entryFree.etym: middle voice from a compound of 2596 and a derivative of 3700 (compare 2072);
entryFree.def: to mirror oneself, i.e. to see reflected (figuratively):--behold as in a glass.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 2596 and a derivative of 3717 (compare 1357);
entryFree.def: something made fully upright, i.e. (figuratively) rectification (specially, good public administration):--very worthy deed.
inferior (locally, of Hades):--lower.
properly, a burn (concretely), but used (abstractly) of a glow:--heat.
to burn:--scorch.
burning (the act):--be burned.
to set on fire:--fervent heat.
a glare:--(burning) heat.
to brand ("cauterize"), i.e. (by implication) to render unsensitive (figuratively):--sear with a hot iron.
a boast (properly, the object; by implication, the act) in a good or a bad sense:--boasting, (whereof) to glory (of), glorying, rejoice(-ing).
boasting (properly, the act; by implication, the object), in a good or a bad sense:--boasting, whereof I may glory, glorying, rejoicing.
Cedron (i.e. Kidron), a brook near Jerusalem:--Cedron.

body.entryFree: κεῖμαι keîmai, ki'-mahee middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched (literally or figuratively):--be (appointed, laid up, made, set), lay, lie. Compare 5087.

entryFree.def: a swathe, i.e. winding-sheet:--graveclothes.
to shear:--shear(-er).
a cry of incitement:--shout.
empty glorying, i.e. self-conceit:--vain-glory.
vainly glorifying, i.e. self-conceited:--desirous of vain-glory.
empty (literally or figuratively):--empty, (in) vain.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed compound of 2756 and 5456;
entryFree.def: empty sounding, i.e. fruitless discussion:--vain.
to make empty, i.e. (figuratively) to abase, neutralize, falsify:--make (of none effect, of no reputation, void), be in vain.
a centurion, i.e. captain of one hundred soldiers:--centurion.
vainly, i.e. to no purpose:--in vain.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a presumed derivative of the base of 2768;
entryFree.def: something horn-like, i.e. (specially) the apex of a Hebrew letter (figuratively, the least particle):--tittle.
a potter:--potter.
made of clay, i.e. earthen:--of a potter.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 2766;
entryFree.def: an earthenware vessel, i.e. jar:--pitcher.

entryFree.etym: probably from the base of 2767 (through the idea of mixing clay and water);
entryFree.def: earthenware, i.e. a tile (by analogy, a thin roof or awning):--tiling.

body.entryFree: KERA/NNUMI κεράννυμι keránnymi ker-an'-noo-mee prolonged form of a more primary κεράω keráō, ker-ah'-o (which is used in certain tenses); to mingle, i.e. (by implication) to pour out (for drinking):--fill, pour out. Compare 3396.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 2768;
entryFree.def: something horned, i.e. (specially) the pod of the carob-tree:--husk.
to gain (literally or figuratively):--(get) gain, win.
gain (pecuniary or genitive case):--gain, lucre.
a clipping (bit), i.e. (specially) a coin:--money.
a handler of coins, i.e. money-broker:--changer of money.
a principal thing, i.e. main point; specially, an amount (of money):--sum.
(specially) to strike on the head:--wound in the head.
properly, a knob, i.e. (by implication) a roll (by extension from the end of a stick on which the manuscript was rolled):--volume.
properly, an enrollment ("census"), i.e. (by implication) a tax:--tribute.
a garden:--garden.
a proclamation (especially of the gospel; by implication, the gospel itself):--preaching.
a herald, i.e. of divine truth (especially of the gospel):--preacher.
to herald (as a public crier), especially divine truth (the gospel):--preacher(-er), proclaim, publish.
a huge fish (as gaping for prey):--whale.
the Rock; Cephas (i.e. Kepha), a surname of Peter:--Cephas.
a box, i.e. the sacred ark and that of Noah:--ark.
a lyre:--harp.
to play on a lyre:--harp.

entryFree.etym: from 2788 and a derivative of the same as 5603;

cinnamon:--cinnamon.
to undergo peril:--be in danger, be (stand) in jeopardy.
danger:--peril.
a stirring:--moving.
Cis (i.e. Kish), an Israelite:--Cis.
a twig or bough (as if broken off):--branch.
to sob, i.e. wail aloud (whereas 1145 is rather to cry silently):--bewail, weep.
fracture (the act):--breaking.
a piece (bit):--broken, fragment.
Claude, an island near Crete:--Clauda.
Claudia, a Christian woman:--Claudia.
Claudius, the name of two Romans:--Claudius.
lamentation:--wailing, weeping, X wept.
to break (specially, of bread):--break.
a key (as shutting a lock), literally or figuratively:--key.
to close (literally or figuratively):--shut (up).
stealing (properly, the thing stolen, but used of the act):--theft.
renown (as if being called):--glory.

body.entryFree: κλέπτης kléptēs, klep'-tace from 2813; a stealer (literally or figuratively):--thief. Compare 3027.

a limb or shoot (as if broken off):--branch.

heirship, i.e. (concretely) a patrimony or (genitive case) a possession:--inheritance.

entryFree.etym: from 2819 and the base of 3551 (in its original sense of partitioning, i.e. (reflexively) getting by apportionment);
entryFree.def: a sharer by lot, i.e. inheritor (literally or figuratively); by implication, a possessor:--heir.

entryFree.etym: probably from 2806 (through the idea of using bits of wood, etc., for the purpose;
entryFree.def: a die (for drawing chances); by implication, a portion (as if so secured); by extension, an acquisition (especially a patrimony, figuratively):--heritage, inheritance, lot, part.
to allot, i.e. (figuratively) to assign (a privilege):--obtain an inheritance.
an invitation (figuratively):--calling.
invited, i.e. appointed, or (specially), a saint:--called.
an earthen pot used for baking in:--oven.
a slope, i.e. (specially) a "clime" or tract of country:--part, region.
a couch (for sleep, sickness, sitting or eating):--bed, table.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 2825;
entryFree.def: a pallet or little couch:--bed.
to slant or slope, i.e. incline or recline (literally or figuratively):--bow (down), be far spent, lay, turn to flight, wear away.
properly, reclination, i.e. (concretely and specially), a party at a meal:--company.
stealing:--theft.
to surge, i.e. (figuratively) to fluctuate:--toss to and fro.

a quadrans, i.e. the fourth part of an as:--farthing.
to put to sleep, i.e. (passively or reflexively) to slumber; figuratively, to decease:--(be a-, fall a-, fall on) sleep, be dead.
sleeping, i.e. (by implication) repose:--taking of rest.
common, i.e. (literally) shared by all or several, or (ceremonially) profane:--common, defiled, unclean, unholy.

a sharer, i.e. associate:--companion, X fellowship, partaker, partner.
a couch; by extension, cohabitation; by implication, the male sperm:--bed, chambering, X conceive.
a bedroom:--+ chamberlain.

entryFree.etym: from 2848 (from the kernel-shape of the insect);
entryFree.def: crimson-colored:--scarlet (colour, coloured).
a kernel of seed:--corn, grain.
penal infliction:--punishment, torment.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the base of 2849;
entryFree.def: to rap with the fist:--buffet.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the base of 2849;
entryFree.def: to dock, i.e. (figuratively) abridge:--shorten.

mourning (properly, by beating the breast):--lamentation.

body.entryFree: κόπτω kóptō, kop'-to a primary verb; to "chop"; specially, to beat the breast in grief:--cut down, lament, mourn, (be-)wail. Compare the base of 5114.

terrene ("cosmic"), literally (mundane) or figuratively (corrupt):--worldly.

cumi (i.e. rise!):--cumi.

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is use only as an alternate in certain tenses; to take (in very many applications, literally and figuratively (properly objective or active, to get hold of; whereas 1209 is rather subjective or passive, to have offered to one;
entryFree.def: while 138 is more violent, to seize or remove)):--accept, + be amazed, assay, attain, bring, X when I call, catch, come on (X unto), + forget, have, hold, obtain, receive (X after), take (away, up).

a loosening, i.e. (specially), divorce:--to be loosed.

entryFree.etym: third person singular present indicative active of a derivative of a compound of 3080 and 5056;
entryFree.def: impersonally, it answers the purpose, i.e. is advantageous:--it is better.
Lystra, a place in Asia Minor:--Lystra.
something to loosen with, i.e. a redemption price (figuratively, atonement):--ransom.
to ransom (literally or figuratively):--redeem.
a ransoming (figuratively):--+ redeemed, redemption.
a redeemer (figuratively):--deliverer.
a lamp-stand (literally or figuratively):--candlestick.
a portable lamp or other illuminator (literally or figuratively):--candle, light.

body.entryFree: λύω lýō, loo'-o a primary verb; to "loosen" (literally or figuratively):--break (up), destroy, dissolve, (un-)loose, melt, put off. Compare 4486.

entryFree.def: Lois, a Christian woman:--Lois.
Lot, a patriarch:--Lot.
Maath, an Israelite:--Maath.
the tower; Magdala (i.e. Migdala), a place in Palestine:--Magdala.
a female Magdalene, i.e. inhabitant of Magdala:--Magdalene.
"magic":--sorcery.
to practice magic:--use sorcery.
a Magian, i.e. Oriental scientist; by implication, a magician:--sorcerer, wise man.
Magog, a foreign nation, i.e. (figuratively) an Antichristian party:--Magog.
Madian (i.e. Midian), a region of Arabia:--Madian.
intransitively, to become a pupil; transitively, to disciple, i.e. enrol as scholar:--be disciple, instruct, teach.
a learner, i.e. pupil:--disciple.
a female pupil:--disciple.
Mathusala (i.e. Methushelach), an antediluvian:--Mathusala.
Mainan, an Israelite:--Mainan.
to beatify, i.e. pronounce (or esteem) fortunate:--call blessed, count happy.
beatification, i.e. attribution of good fortune:--blessedness.
Macedonia, a region of Greece:--Macedonia.
a Macedon (Macedonian), i.e. inhabitant of Macedonia:--of Macedonia, Macedonian.
a butcher's stall, meat market or provision-shop:--shambles.

entryFree.etym: feminine accusative case singular of 3117 (3598 being implied);
entryFree.def: at a distance (literally or figuratively):--(a-)far (off), good (great) way off.
from a distance or afar:--afar off, from far.
to be long-spirited, i.e. (objectively) forbearing or (subjectively) patient:--bear (suffer) long, be longsuffering, have (long) patience, be patient, patiently endure.
longanimity, i.e. (objectively) forbearance or (subjectively) fortitude:--longsuffering, patience.

entryFree.etym: adverb of a compound of 3117 and 2372;
entryFree.def: with long (enduring) temper, i.e. leniently:--patiently.
long (in place (distant) or time (neuter plural)):--far, long.
long-timed, i.e. long-lived:--live long.
softness, i.e. enervation (debility):--disease.
soft, i.e. fine (clothing); figuratively, a catamite:--effeminate, soft.
Maleleel (i.e. Mahalalel), an antediluvian:--Maleleel.

entryFree.etym: neuter of the comparative of the same as 3122;
entryFree.def: (adverbially) more (in a greater degree) or rather:--+ better, X far, (the) more (and more), (so) much (the more), rather.
Malchus, an Israelite:--Malchus.
a grandmother:--grandmother.

entryFree.etym: of Chaldee origin (confidence, i.e. wealth, personified);
entryFree.def: mammonas, i.e. avarice (deified):--mammon.
Manaën, a Christian:--Manaen.
Mannasses (i.e. Menashsheh), an Israelite:--Manasses.
craziness:--(+ make) X mad.
manna (i.e. man), an edible gum:--manna.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of 3105 (meaning a prophet, as supposed to rave through inspiration);
entryFree.def: to divine, i.e. utter spells (under pretense of foretelling:--by soothsaying.
to extinguish (as fire), i.e. (figuratively and passively) to pass away:--fade away.

entryFree.etym: of Chaldee origin (meaning our Lord has come);
entryFree.def: maranatha, i.e. an exclamation of the approaching divine judgment:--Maran-atha.
Martha, a Christian woman:--Martha.
Marcus, a Christian:--Marcus, Mark.

to be a witness, i.e. testify (literally or figuratively):--charge, give (evidence), bear record, have (obtain, of) good (honest) report, be well reported of, testify, give (have) testimony, (be, bear, give, obtain) witness.
evidence given (judicially or genitive case):--record, report, testimony, witness.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 3144;
entryFree.def: something evidential, i.e. (genitive case) evidence given or (specially), the Decalogue (in the sacred Tabernacle):--to be testified, testimony, witness.
to be adduced as a witness, i.e. (figuratively) to obtest (in affirmation or exhortation):--take to record, testify.
a witness (literally (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case)); by analogy, a "martyr":-- martyr, record, witness.
to flog (literally or figuratively):--scourge.
to whip (literally):--scourge.

entryFree.etym: probably from the base of 3145 (through the idea of contact);
entryFree.def: a whip (literally, the Roman flagellum for criminals; figuratively, a disease):--plague, scourging.
a (properly, female) breast (as if kneaded up):--pap.
random talk, i.e. babble:--vain jangling.
an idle (i.e. senseless or mischievous) talker, i.e. a wrangler:--vain talker.
empty, i.e. (literally) profitless, or (specially), an idol:--vain, vanity.
inutility; figuratively, transientness; morally, depravity:--vanity.
to render (passively, become) foolish, i.e. (morally) wicked or (specially), idolatrous:--become vain.

entryFree.etym: accusative case of a derivative of the base of 3145 (through the idea of tentative manipulation, i.e. unsuccessful search, or else of punishment);
entryFree.def: folly, i.e. (adverbially) to no purpose:--in vain.
Matthæus (i.e. Matthitjah), an Israelite and a Christian:--Matthew.
Matthan (i.e. Mattan), an Israelite:--Matthan.
Matthat (i.e. Mattithjah), the name of two Israelites:--Mathat.
Matthias (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite:--Matthias.
Mattatha (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite:--Mattatha.
Mattathias (i.e. Mattithjah), an Israelite and a Christian:--Mattathias.

entryFree.etym: probably feminine of a presumed derivative of 3163;
entryFree.def: a knife, i.e. dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment:--sword.
a battle, i.e. (figuratively) controversy:--fighting, strive, striving.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of an apparently primary verb;
entryFree.def: to war, i.e. (figuratively) to quarrel, dispute:--fight, strive.

entryFree.etym: a shorter (and probably original) form of 1691;
entryFree.def: me:--I, me, my.
magnificent, i.e. (neuter, plural as noun) a conspicuous favor, or (subjectively) perfection:--great things, wonderful works.
superbness, i.e. glory or splendor:--magnificence, majesty, mighty power.
befitting greatness or magnificence (majestic):--excellent.
to make (or declare) great, i.e. increase or (figuratively) extol:--enlarge, magnify, shew great.
much:--greatly.
greatness, i.e. (figuratively) divinity (often God himself):--majesty.
magnitude (figuratively):--greatness.
grandees:--great men, lords.
greatest or very great:--exceeding great.
to explain over, i.e. translate:--(by) interpret(-ation).
an intoxicant, i.e. (by implication) intoxication:--drunkenness.
travelling over, i.e. travesty (trickery):--wile, lie in wait.
bounded alongside, i.e. contiguous (neuter plural as noun, frontier):--border.
to intoxicate:--be drunk(-en).
tipsy, i.e. (as noun) a sot:--drunkard.
to drink to intoxication, i.e. get drunk:--drink well, make (be) drunk(-en).
(adverbially) in greater degree:--the more.
still larger (figuratively):--greater.
larger (literally or figuratively, specially, in age):--elder, greater(-est), more.
ink:--ink.
black:--black.
Meleas, an Israelite:--Meleas.
to take care of, i.e. (by implication) revolve in the mind:--imagine, (pre-)meditate.
honey:--honey.
relating to honey, i.e. bee (comb):--honeycomb.
Melita, an island in the Mediterranean:--Melita.

entryFree.etym: a strengthened form of 3199 (through the idea of expectation);
entryFree.def: to intend, i.e. be about to be, do, or suffer something (of persons or things, especially events; in the sense of purpose, duty, necessity, probability, possibility, or hesitation):--about, after that, be (almost), (that which is, things, + which was for) to come, intend, was to (be), mean, mind, be at the point, (be) ready, + return, shall (begin), (which, that) should (after, afterwards, hereafter) tarry, which was for, will, would, be yet.
a limb or part of the body:--member.

entryFree.etym: of Hebrew origin [04428 with pronominal suffix, my king];
entryFree.def: Melchi (i.e. Malki), the name of two Israelites:--Melchi.
Melchisedek (i.e. Malkitsedek), a patriarch:--Melchisedec.
to be of interest to, i.e. to concern (only third person singular present indicative used impersonally, it matters):--(take) care.
a (written) sheep-skin:--parchment.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of an apparently primary verb;
entryFree.def: to blame:--find fault.

μέν mén, men a primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession (in fact); usually followed by a contrasted clause with 1161 (this one, the former, etc.):--even, indeed, so, some, truly, verily. Often compounded with other particles in an intensive or asseverative sense.

entryFree.def: so then at least:--nay but, yea doubtless (rather, verily).
indeed though, i.e. however:--also, but, howbeit, nevertheless, yet.
to stay (in a given place, state, relation or expectancy):--abide, continue, dwell, endure, be present, remain, stand, tarry (for), X thine own.
to part, i.e. (literally) to apportion, bestow, share, or (figuratively) to disunite, differ:--deal, be difference between, distribute, divide, give part.
solicitude:--care.
to be anxious about:--(be, have) care(-ful), take thought.
a portion, i.e. province, share or (abstractly) participation:--part (X -akers).
a separation or distribution:--dividing asunder, gift.
an apportioner (administrator):--divider.
midday; by implication, the south:--noon, south.
to interpose (as arbiter), i.e (by implication) to ratify (as surety):--confirm.
a go-between, i.e. (simply) an internunciator, or (by implication) a reconciler (intercessor):--mediator.
midnight (especially as a watch):--midnight.
Mesopotamia [as lying between the Euphrates and the Tigris; compare 0763], a region of Asia:--Mesopotamia.
middle (as an adjective or (neuter) noun):--among, X before them, between, + forth, mid(-day, -night), midst, way.
a partition (figuratively):--middle wall.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed compound of 3319 and 3772;
entryFree.def: mid-sky:--midst of heaven.
to form the middle, i.e. (in point of time), to be half-way over:--be about the midst.
the Messias (i.e. Mashiach), or Christ:--Messias.
replete (literally or figuratively):--full.
to replenish, i.e. (by implication) to intoxicate:--fill.

body.entryFree: μετά metá, met-ah' a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; "amid" (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between 575 or 1537 and 1519 or 4314; less intimate than 1722 and less close than 4862):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). Often used in composition, in substantially the same relations of participation or proximity, and transfer or sequence.

entryFree.def: to change place:--depart, go, pass, remove.
to throw over, i.e. (middle voice figuratively) to turn about in opinion:--change mind.
to lead over, i.e. transfer (direct):--turn about.
to give over, i.e. share:--give, impart.
transposition, i.e. transferral (to heaven), disestablishment (of a law):--change, removing, translation.
to betake oneself, i.e. remove (locally):--depart.
to call elsewhere, i.e. summon:--call (for, hither).
to stir to a place elsewhere, i.e. remove (figuratively):--move away.
to participate; genitive case, to accept (and use):--eat, have, be partaker, receive, take.
participation:--taking.
to exchange:--change.

entryFree.etym: from 3326 and the middle voice of 3199;
entryFree.def: to care afterwards, i.e. regret:--repent (self).
to transform (literally or figuratively, "metamorphose"):--change, transfigure, transform.
to think differently or afterwards, i.e. reconsider (morally, feel compunction):--repent.
(subjectively) compunction (for guilt, including reformation); by implication, reversal (of (another's) decision):--repentance.
betwixt (of place or person); (of time) as adjective, intervening, or (by implication) adjoining:--between, mean while, next.
to send from elsewhere, i.e. (middle voice) to summon or invite:--call (send) for.
to turn across, i.e. transmute or (figuratively) corrupt:--pervert, turn.
to transfigure or disguise; figuratively, to apply (by accommodation):--transfer, transform (self).
to transfer, i.e. (literally) transport, (by implication) exchange, (reflexively) change sides, or (figuratively) pervert:--carry over, change, remove, translate, turn.
thereafter:--afterward.
to share or participate; by implication, belong to, eat (or drink):--be partaker, pertain, take part, use.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 3326 and a collateral form of 142 or perhaps rather 109 (compare "meteor");
entryFree.def: to raise in mid-air, i.e. (figuratively) suspend (passively, fluctuate or be anxious):--be of doubtful mind.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of a compound of 3326 and 3624;
entryFree.def: a change of abode, i.e. (specially), expatriation:--X brought, carried(-ying) away (in-)to.
to transfer as a settler or captive, i.e colonize or exile:--carry away, remove into.
participation, i.e. intercourse:--fellowship.
participant, i.e. (as noun) a sharer; by implication, an associate:--fellow, partaker, partner.
to measure (i.e. ascertain in size by a fixed standard); by implication, to admeasure (i.e. allot by rule):--figuratively, to estimate:--measure, mete.
a measurer, i.e. (specially), a certain standard measure of capacity for liquids:--firkin.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of the base of 3357 and 3806;
entryFree.def: to be moderate in passion, i.e. gentle (to treat indulgently):--have compassion.
moderately, i.e. slightly:--a little.
a measure ("metre"), literally or figuratively; by implication, a limited portion (degree):-- measure.
the forehead (as opposite the countenance):--forehead.

body.entryFree: μή mḗ, may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas 3756 expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas 3756 expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also 3362, 3363, 3364, 3372, 3373, 3375, 3378.

entryFree.def: if not, i.e. unless:--X before, but, except, if, no, (if, + whosoever) not.
in order (or so) that not:--albeit not, lest, that, no(-t, (-thing)).

body.entryFree: οὐ μή ou mḗ, oo may i.e. 3756 and 3361; a double negative strengthening the denial; not at all:--any more, at all, by any (no) means, neither, never, no (at all), in no case (wise), nor ever, not (at all, in any wise). Compare 3378.

entryFree.def: but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor:--neither, nor (yet), (no) not (once, so much as).
not even ever:--never.
not even yet:--not yet.
a Median, or inhabitant of Media:--Mede.
no further:--any longer, (not) henceforth, hereafter, no henceforward (longer, more, soon), not any more.
length (literally or figuratively):--length.
to lengthen, i.e. (middle voice) to enlarge:--grow up.
a particle of affirmation (only with 2229); assuredly:--+ surely.
a month:--month.

body.entryFree: μὴ οὐκ mḕ ouk, ouk may ook i.e. 3361 and 3756; as interrogative and negative, is it not that?:--neither (followed by no), + never, not. Compare 3364.

entryFree.def: not yet:--not yet.
a thigh:--thigh.
not too, i.e. (in continued negation) neither or nor; also, not even:--neither, (n-)or, so as much.
a "mother" (literally or figuratively, immediate or remote):--mother.
whether at all:--not (the particle usually not expressed, except by the form of the question).
not at all then, i.e. not to say (the rather still):--how much more.
the matrix:--womb.
a mother-thresher, i.e. matricide:--murderer of mothers.
a mother city, i.e. "metropolis":--chiefest city.
one or first:--a (certain), + agree, first, one, X other.
to sully or taint, i.e. contaminate (ceremonially or morally):--defile.
(morally) foulness (properly, the effect):--pollution.
(morally) contamination (properly, the act):--uncleanness.
a compound:--mixture.
to mix:--mingle.

entryFree.etym: masculine or neuter singular of 3398 (as noun);
entryFree.def: a small space of time or degree:--a (little) (while).
Miletus, a city of Asia Minor:--Miletus.
a thousand paces, i.e. a "mile":--mile.
an imitator:--follower.

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of 3415 (from which some of the tenses are borrowed);
entryFree.def: to remind, i.e. (middle voice) to recall to mind:--be mindful, remember.
requital (good or bad):--recompence of reward.
a renumerator:--rewarder.
a wage-earner:--hired servant.
pay for service (literally or figuratively), good or bad:--hire, reward, wages.
to let out for wages, i.e. (middle voice) to hire:--hire.
a rented building:--hired house.
a wage-worker (good or bad):--hired servant, hireling.
Michael, an archangel:--Michael.
a mna (i.e. mina), a certain weight:-- pound.

body.entryFree: μνάομαι mnáomai, mnah'-om-ahee middle voice of a derivative of 3306 or perhaps of the base of 3145 (through the idea of fixture in the mind or of mental grasp); to bear in mind, i.e. recollect; by implication, to reward or punish:--be mindful, remember, come (have) in remembrance. Compare 3403.

entryFree.def: Mnason, a Christian:--Mnason.
recollection; by implication, recital:--mention, remembrance.
a memorial, i.e. sepulchral monument (burial-place):--grave, sepulchre, tomb.
a remembrance, i.e. cenotaph (place of interment):--grave, sepulchre, tomb.
memory:--remembrance.
to exercise memory, i.e. recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse:--make mention; be mindful, remember.
a reminder (memorandum), i.e. record:--memorial.
to give a souvenir (engagement present), i.e. betroth:--espouse.
hardly talking, i.e. dumb (tongue-tied):--having an impediment in his speech.
a modius, i.e. certain measure for things dry (the quantity or the utensil):--bushel.
to me:--I, me, mine, my.

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of the feminine of 3432;
entryFree.def: an adulteress (literally or figuratively):--adulteress(-ous, -y).
(middle voice) to commit adultery:--commit adultery.
adultery:--adultery.
to commit adultery:--commit adultery.
a (male) paramour; figuratively, apostate:--adulterer.
with difficulty:--hardly, scarce(-ly), + with much work.
Moloch (i.e. Molek), an idol:--Moloch.
to soil (figuratively):--defile.
a stain; i.e. (figuratively) immorality:--filthiness.
blame, i.e. (by implication), a fault:--quarrel.
a staying, i.e. residence (the act or the place):--abode, mansion.
only-born, i.e. sole:--only (begotten, child).
merely:--alone, but, only.
remaining, i.e. sole or single; by implication, mere:--alone, only, by themselves.
one-eyed:--with one eye.
to isolate, i.e. bereave:--be desolate.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from the base of 3313 (through the idea of adjustment of parts);
entryFree.def: shape; figuratively, nature:--form.
to fashion (figuratively):--form.
formation, i.e. (by implication), appearance (semblance or (concretely) formula):--form.
to fabricate the image of a bullock:--make a calf.
toil, i.e. (by implication) sadness:--painfulness, travail.
of me:--I, me, mine (own), my.
the marrow:--marrow.
to initiate, i.e. (by implication) to teach:--instruct.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from the same as 3453 (through the idea of tuition);
entryFree.def: a tale, i.e. fiction ("myth"):--fable.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the base of 3455 (meaning snout, as that whence lowing proceeds);
entryFree.def: to make mouths at, i.e. ridicule:--mock.
belonging to a mill:--mill(-stone).

entryFree.etym: probably ultimately from the base of 3433 (through the idea of hardship);
entryFree.def: a "mill", i.e. (by implication), a grinder (millstone):--millstone.
a mill-house:--mill.
Myra, a place in Asia Minor:--Myra.
a ten-thousand; by extension, a "myriad" or indefinite number:--ten thousand.
to apply (perfumed) unguent to:--anoint.

entryFree.etym: plural of an apparently primary word (properly, meaning very many);
entryFree.def: ten thousand; by extension, innumerably many:--ten thousand.
"myrrh", i.e. (by implication) perfumed oil:--ointment.
Mysia, a region of Asia Minor:--Mysia.
to carp at, i.e. censure (discredit):--blame.
a flaw or blot, i.e. (figuratively) disgraceful person:--blemish.
to become insipid; figuratively, to make (passively, act) as a simpleton:--become fool, make foolish, lose savour.
silliness, i.e. absurdity:--foolishness.
silly talk, i.e. buffoonery:--foolish talking.
dull or stupid (as if shut up), i.e. heedless, (morally) blockhead, (apparently) absurd:--fool(-ish, X -ishness).
Naasson (i.e. Nachshon), an Israelite:--Naasson.
Nangæ (i.e. perhaps Nogach), an Israelite:--Nagge.
a Nazarene, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth:--of Nazareth.
a Nazoræan, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian:--Nazarene, of Nazareth.
Nathan, an Israelite:--Nathan.
Nathanaël (i.e. Nathanel), an Israelite and Christian:--Nathanael.

entryFree.etym: a primary particle of strong affirmation;
entryFree.def: yes:--even so, surely, truth, verily, yea, yes.
Nain, a place in Palestine:--Nain.

body.entryFree: NAO/S ναός naós nah-os' from a primary ναίω naíō, (to dwell); a fane, shrine, temple :--shrine, temple. Compare 2411.

entryFree.def: Naum (i.e. Nachum), an Israelite:--Naum.
"nard":--(spike-)nard.
to be shipwrecked (stranded, "navigate"), literally or figuratively:--make (suffer) shipwreck.
a captain:--owner of a ship.
a boatman, i.e. seaman:--sailor, shipman.
Nachor, the grandfather of Abraham:--Nachor.
a youth (up to about forty years):--young man.
a youth (under forty):--young man.
new town; Neapolis, a place in Macedonia:--Neapolis.
Neeman (i.e. Naaman), a Syrian:--Naaman.
to deaden, i.e. (figuratively) to subdue:--be dead, mortify.
decease; figuratively, impotency:--deadness, dying.
a youngling (nestling):--young.
newness, i.e. youthfulness:--youth.
newly planted, i.e. (figuratively) a young convert ("neophyte"):--novice.
Neron (i.e. Nero), a Roman emperor:--Nero.
to "nod", i.e. (by analogy), signal:--beckon.
properly, cloudiness, i.e. (concretely) a cloud:--cloud.
Nephthaleim (i.e. Naphthali), a tribe in Palestine:--Nephthalim.
a cloud:--cloud.
a kidney (plural), i.e. (figuratively) the inmost mind:--reins.
appertaining to younger persons, i.e. juvenile:--youthful.
a particle of attestation (accompanied by the object invoked or appealed to in confirmation); as sure as:--I protest by.
to act as a babe, i.e. (figuratively) innocently:--be a child.

entryFree.etym: apparently from a derivative of the base of 3491 (meaning wet);
entryFree.def: Nereus, a Christian:--Nereus.
Neri (i.e. Nerijah), an Israelite:--Neri.
an islet:--island.
an island:--island, isle.
abstinence (from lack of food, or voluntary and religious); specially, the fast of the Day of Atonement:-- fast(-ing).
to abstain from food (religiously):--fast.
to abstain from wine (keep sober), i.e. (figuratively) be discreet:--be sober, watch.
black; Niger, a Christian:--Niger.
victorious; Nicanor, a Christian:--Nicanor.
to subdue (literally or figuratively):--conquer, overcome, prevail, get the victory.
conquest (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) the means of success:--victory.

a Nicolaïte, i.e. adherent of Nicolaüs:--Nicolaitane.
victorious over the people; Nicolaüs, a heretic:--Nicolaus.
victorious city; Nicopolis, a place in Macedonia:--Nicopolis.
a conquest (concretely), i.e. (by implication) triumph:--victory.
Ninevi (i.e. Nineveh), the capital of Assyria:--Nineve.
a Ninevite, i.e. inhabitant of Nineveh:--of Nineve, Ninevite.
a ewer:--bason.

body.entryFree: νίπτω níptō, nip'-to to cleanse (especially the hands or the feet or the face); ceremonially, to perform ablution:--wash. Compare 3068.

entryFree.def: to exercise the mind (observe), i.e. (figuratively) to comprehend, heed:--consider, perceive, think, understand.
a perception, i.e. purpose, or (by implication) the intellect, disposition, itself:--device, mind, thought.
a spurious or illegitimate son:--bastard.
pasture, i.e. (the act) feeding (figuratively, spreading of a gangrene), or (the food) pasturage:--X eat, pasture.
properly, to do by law (usage), i.e. to accustom (passively, be usual); by extension, to deem or regard:-- suppose, thing, be wont.
according (or pertaining) to law, i.e. legal (ceremonially); as noun, an expert in the (Mosaic) law:--about the law, lawyer.
legitimately (specially, agreeably to the rules of the lists):--lawfully.
what is reckoned as of value (after the Latin numisma), i.e. current coin:--money.

legislation (specially, the institution of the Mosaic code):--giving of the law.
to legislate, i.e. (passively) to have (the Mosaic) enactments injoined, be sanctioned (by them):--establish, receive the law.
a legislator:--lawgiver.
to be sick, i.e. (by implication, of a diseased appetite) to hanker after (figuratively, to harp upon):--dote.
an ailment:--disease.
a malady (rarely figuratively, of moral disability):--disease, infirmity, sickness.
a brood (of chickens):--brood.
a birdling:--chicken.
the south(-west) wind; by extension, the southern quarter itself:--south (wind).
calling attention to, i.e. (by implication) mild rebuke or warning:--admonition.
to put in mind, i.e. (by implication) to caution or reprove gently:--admonish, warn.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a compound of 3501 and 3376 (as noun by implication, of 2250);

entryFree.etym: adverb from a compound of the accusative case of 3563 and 2192;
entryFree.def: in a mind-having way, i.e. prudently:--discreetly.

body.entryFree: νοῦς noûs, nooce probably from the base of 1097; the intellect, i.e. mind (divine or human; in thought, feeling, or will); by implication, meaning:--mind, understanding. Compare 5590.

entryFree.etym: probably contracted for a compound of 3565 and 1435;
entryFree.def: nymph-given (i.e. -born); Nymphas, a Christian:--Nymphas.
a bride-groom (literally or figuratively):--bridegroom.
the bridal room:--bridechamber.

body.entryFree: νῦν nŷn, noon a primary particle of present time; "now" (as adverb of date, a transition or emphasis); also as noun or adjective present or immediate:--henceforth, + hereafter, of late, soon, present, this (time). See also 3569, 3570.

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of 3568 for emphasis;
entryFree.def: just now:--now.
"night" (literally or figuratively):-- (mid-)night.
to prick ("nudge"):--pierce.
to nod, i.e. (by implication) to fall asleep; figuratively, to delay:--slumber.
a day-and-night, i.e. full day of twenty-four hours:--night and day.
Noë, (i.e. Noäch), a patriarch:--Noe.
sluggish, i.e. (literally) lazy, or (figuratively) stupid:--dull, slothful.
the back:--back.
hospitality, i.e. (by implication) a place of entertainment:--lodging.
to be a host (passively, a guest); by implication, be (make, appear) strange:--entertain, lodge, (think it) strange.

foreign (literally, alien, or figuratively, novel); by implication, a guest or (vice-versa) entertainer:--host, strange(-r).
to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature:--dry up, pine away, be ripe, wither (away).

entryFree.etym: from the base of 3582 (through the idea of scorching);

entryFree.def: timber (as fuel or material); by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance:--staff, stocks, tree, wood.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the same as 3586 (meaning a razor);

the eighth:--eighth.
a mass (as bending or bulging by its load), i.e. burden (hindrance):--weight.
to travel:--journey.
to show the way (literally or figuratively (teach)):--guide, lead.
a conductor (literally or figuratively (teacher)):--guide, leader.
to be a wayfarer, i.e. travel:--go on a journey.
travel:--journey(-ing).
a road; by implication, a progress (the route, act or distance); figuratively, a mode or means:--journey, (high-)way.
a "tooth":--tooth.
to grieve:--sorrow, torment.
grief (as dejecting):--sorrow.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the base of 1416;
entryFree.def: moaning, i.e. lamentation:--mourning.

entryFree.etym: from the neuter of 3739 and the third person singular present indicative of 1510;

entryFree.etym: a primary verb (in a strengthened form);
entryFree.def: to scent (usually an ill "odor"):--stink.

entryFree.etym: from 3739 with the directive enclitic of source;

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 3607;
entryFree.def: a linen bandage:--linen clothes.
domestic, i.e. (as noun), a relative, adherent:--(those) of the (his own) house(-hold).
a fellow resident, i.e. menial domestic:--(household) servant.

body.entryFree: οἰκέω oikéō, oy-keh'-o from 3624; to occupy a house, i.e. reside (figuratively, inhabit, remain, inhere); by implication, to cohabit:--dwell. See also 3625.

entryFree.def: a tenement, i.e. (specially), a jail:--prison.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 3611 (equivalent to 3612);

familiar, i.e. (as noun) relatives:--they (them) of (his own) household.
to be the head of (i.e. rule) a family:--guide the house.
the head of a family:--goodman (of the house), householder, master of the house.
to be a house-builder, i.e. construct or (figuratively) confirm:--(be in) build(-er, -ing, up), edify, embolden.

to manage (a house, i.e. an estate):--be steward.
administration (of a household or estate); specially, a (religious) "economy":--dispensation, stewardship.

a house-distributor (i.e. manager), or overseer, i.e. an employee in that capacity; by extension, a fiscal agent (treasurer); figuratively, a preacher (of the Gospel):--chamberlain, governor, steward.
a dwelling (more or less extensive, literal or figurative); by implication, a family (more or less related, literally or figuratively):--home, house(-hold), temple.

entryFree.etym: feminine participle present passive of 3611 (as noun, by implication, of 1093);

pity:--mercy.
compassionate:--merciful, of tender mercy.

entryFree.etym: from 3631 and a derivative of the alternate of 4095;

entryFree.etym: a primary word [or perhaps of Hebrew origin (03196]);

such or what sort of (as a correlation or exclamation); especially the neuter (adverbially) with negative, not so:--so (as), such as, what (manner of), which.
tardy, i.e. indolent; (figuratively) irksome:--grievous, slothful.
an eight-day old person or act:--the eighth day.
"eight":--eight.
incredulous, i.e. lacking confidence (in Christ):--of little faith.
puny (in extent, degree, number, duration or value); especially neuter (adverbially) somewhat:--+ almost, brief(-ly), few, (a) little, + long, a season, short, small, a while.
little-spirited, i.e. faint-hearted:--feebleminded.
a ruiner, i.e. (specially), a venomous serpent:--destroyer.
to spoil, i.e. slay:--destroy.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of a compound of 3650 and a derivative of 2545;

an unripe (because out of season) fig:--untimely fig.

a thunder storm:--shower.
to be in company with, i.e. (by implication) to converse:--commune, talk.
companionship ("homily"), i.e. (by implication) intercourse:--communication.

a form; abstractly, resemblance:--made like to, likeness, shape, similitude.
similarly:--likewise, so.
assimilation, i.e. resemblance:--similitude.

entryFree.def: to assent, i.e. covenant, acknowledge:--con- (pro-)fess, confession is made, give thanks, promise.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 3688;

to defame, i.e. rail at, chide, taunt:--cast in teeth, (suffer) reproach, revile, upbraid.
contumely:--reproach.

belonging to a ass, i.e. large (so as to be turned by a ass):--millstone.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed derivative of the base of 1097 (compare 3685);

entryFree.etym: adverb of the oblique cases of 5607;

vinegar, i.e. sour wine:--vinegar.

entryFree.def: keen; by analogy, rapid:--sharp, swift.
a hole (as if for light), i.e. cavern; by analogy, a spring (of water):--cave, place.

entryFree.etym: from the same as 3693 with enclitic of direction;

gazed at, i.e. (by implication) capable of being seen:--visible.

entryFree.etym: properly, to stare at (compare 3700), i.e. (by implication) to discern clearly (physically or mentally);
entryFree.def: by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear:--behold, perceive, see, take heed.

properly, desire (as a reaching forth or excitement of the mind), i.e. (by analogy), violent passion (ire, or (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment:--anger, indignation, vengeance, wrath.
to provoke or enrage, i.e. (passively) become exasperated:--be angry (wroth).
irascible:--soon angry.
a stretch of the arms, i.e. a fathom:--fathom.

excitement of the mind, i.e. longing after:--lust.
to be straight-footed, i.e. (figuratively) to go directly forward:--walk uprightly.
right (as rising), i.e. (perpendicularly) erect (figuratively, honest), or (horizontally) level or direct:--straight, upright.

in the dawn, i.e. up at day-break:--early.
dawn (as sun-rise, rising of light); by extension, morn:--early in the morning.
in a straight manner, i.e. (figuratively) correctly (also morally):--plain, right(-ly).
to mark out or bound ("horizon"), i.e. (figuratively) to appoint, decree, specify:--declare, determine, limit, ordain.
to put on oath, i.e. make swear; by analogy, to solemnly enjoin:--adjure, charge.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 3727 and a derivative of 3660;
entryFree.def: asseveration on oath:--oath.

a violent impulse, i.e. onset:--assault.
an attack, i.e. (abstractly) precipitancy:--violence.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 3733;
entryFree.def: a birdling:--bird, fowl.

entryFree.etym: probably from a prolonged form of the base of 3735;
entryFree.def: a bird (as rising in the air), i.e. (specially), a hen (or female domestic fowl):--hen.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of the base of 3725 and a derivative of 5087;
entryFree.def: a limit-placing, i.e. (concretely) boundary-line:--bound.

entryFree.def: how (i.e. with 302, so) many times as:--as oft(-en) as.

body.entryFree: ὅσιος hósios, hos'-ee-os of uncertain affinity; properly, right (by intrinsic or divine character; thus distinguished from 1342, which refers rather to human statutes and relations; from 2413, which denotes formal consecration; and from 40, which relates to purity from defilement), i.e. hallowed (pious, sacred, sure):--holy, mercy, shalt be. 342

fragrance (literally or figuratively):--odour, savour.

who especially:--whomsoever.

body.entryFree: O(/STIS ὅστις hóstis hos'-tis, including the feminine H(/TIS ἥτις hḗtis hay'-tis, and the neuter ὅτι hóti, hot'-ee from 3739 and 5100; which some, i.e. any that; also (definite) which same:--X and (they), (such) as, (they) that, in that they, what(-soever), whereas ye, (they) which, who(-soever). entryFree.def: smell (the sense):--smelling.

at which (thing) too, i.e. when:--after (that), as soon as, that, when, while.
demonstrative, that (sometimes redundant); causative, because:--as concerning that, as though, because (that), for (that), how (that), (in) that, though, why.

celestial, i.e. belonging to or coming from the sky:--heavenly.

the ear (physically or mentally):--ear.

body.entryFree: O)FEI/LW ὀφείλω opheílō of-i'-lo, or (in certain tenses), its prolonged form ὀφειλέω opheiléō, of-i-leh'-o probably from the base of 3786 (through the idea of accruing); to owe (pecuniarily); figuratively, to be under obligation (ought, must, should); morally, to fail in duty:--behove, be bound, (be) debt(-or), (be) due(-ty), be guilty (indebted), (must) need(-s), ought, owe, should. tutorage, i.e. education or training; by implication, disciplinary correction:--chastening, chastisement, instruction, nurture.
