to train up a child, i.e. educate, or (by implication), discipline (by punishment):--chasten(-ise), instruct, learn, teach.
from infancy:--of a child.
a childling (of either sex), i.e. (properly), an infant, or (by extension) a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian:--(little, young) child, damsel.
a girl, i.e. (specially), a female slave or servant:--bondmaid(-woman), damsel, maid(-en).
to sport (as a boy):--play.

a boy (as often beaten with impunity), or (by analogy), a girl, and (genitive case) a child; specially, a slave or servant (especially a minister to a king; and by eminence to God):--child, maid(-en), (man) servant, son, young man.
to hit (as if by a single blow and less violently than 5180); specially, to sting (as a scorpion):--smite, strike.

entryFree.etym: feminine of an adjective of uncertain derivation;
entryFree.def: Pacatianian, a section of Phrygia:--Pacatiana.

entryFree.etym: probably another form for 3825 (through the idea of retrocession);
entryFree.def: (adverbially) formerly, or (by relatively) sometime since; (elliptically as adjective) ancient:--any while, a great while ago, (of) old, in time past.
antique, i.e. not recent, worn out:--old.
antiquatedness:--oldness.
to make (passively, become) worn out, or declare obsolete:--decay, make (wax) old.
(spiritual) rebirth (the state or the act), i.e. (figuratively) spiritual renovation; specially, Messianic restoration:--regeneration.

entryFree.etym: probably from the same as 3823 (through the idea of oscillatory repetition);
entryFree.def: (adverbially) anew, i.e. (of place) back, (of time) once more, or (conjunctionally) furthermore or on the other hand:--again.

entryFree.etym: dative case (adverb) of a compound of 3956 and 4128;
entryFree.def: in full multitude, i.e. concertedly or simultaneously:--all at once.
full many, i.e. immense:--very great.
every-tribal, i.e. heterogeneous (5561 being implied); Pamphylia, a region of Asia Minor:--Pamphylia.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed compound of 3956 and a derivative of 1209;
entryFree.def: all-receptive, i.e. a public lodging-place (caravanserai or khan):--inn.
an innkeeper (warden of a caravanserai):--host.
a mass-meeting, i.e. (figuratively) universal companionship:--general assembly.
with the whole family:--with all his house.
full armor ("panoply"):--all (whole) armour.
adroitness, i.e. (in a bad sense) trickery or sophistry:--(cunning) craftiness, subtilty.
all-working, i.e. adroit (shrewd):--crafty.
from all directions:--from every quarter.

entryFree.etym: genitive case (as adverb of place) of a presumed derivative of 3956;
entryFree.def: universally:--in all places, everywhere.
full-ended, i.e. entire (neuter as noun, completion):--+ in (no) wise, uttermost.
wholly:--always.
from (i.e. on) all sides:--on every side, round about.
the all-ruling, i.e. God (as absolute and universal sovereign):--Almighty, Omnipotent.
every when, i.e. at all times:--alway(-s), ever(-more).
entirely; specially, at all events, (with negative, following) in no event:--by all means, altogether, at all, needs, no doubt, in (no) wise, surely.

body.entryFree: παρά pará, par-ah' a primary preposition; properly, near; i.e. (with genitive case) from beside (literally or figuratively), (with dative case) at (or in) the vicinity of (objectively or subjectively), (with accusative case) to the proximity with (local (especially beyond or opposed to) or causal (on account of):--above, against, among, at, before, by, contrary to, X friend, from, + give (such things as they), + that (she) had, X his, in, more than, nigh unto, (out) of, past, save, side…by, in the sight of, than, (there-)fore, with. In compounds it retains the same variety of application.

entryFree.def: to go contrary to, i.e. violate a command:--(by) transgress(-ion).
to throw alongside, i.e. (reflexively) to reach a place, or (figuratively) to liken:--arrive, compare.
violation:--breaking, transgression.
a violator:--breaker, transgress(-or).

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and the middle voice of 971;
entryFree.def: to force contrary to (nature), i.e. compel (by entreaty):--constrain.
a similitude ("parable"), i.e. (symbolic) fictitious narrative (of common life conveying a moral), apothegm or adage:--comparison, figure, parable, proverb.

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and the middle voice of 1011;
entryFree.def: to misconsult, i.e. disregard:--not (to) regard(-ing).
a mandate:--charge, command.
to transmit a message, i.e. (by implication) to enjoin:--(give in) charge, (give) command(-ment), declare.
to become near, i.e. approach (have arrived); by implication, to appear publicly:--come, go, be present.
to lead near, i.e. (reflexively or intransitively) to go along or away:--depart, pass (away, by, forth).
to show alongside (the public), i.e. expose to infamy:--make a public example, put to an open shame.
a park, i.e. (specially), an Eden (place of future happiness, "paradise"):--paradise.
to accept near, i.e. admit or (by implication) delight in:--receive.
misemployment, i.e. meddlesomeness:--perverse disputing.
to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit:--betray, bring forth, cast, commit, deliver (up), give (over, up), hazard, put in prison, recommend.

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and 1391 (in the sense of seeming);
entryFree.def: contrary to expectation, i.e. extraordinary ("paradox"):--strange.
transmission, i.e. (concretely) a precept; specially, the Jewish traditionary law:--ordinance, tradition.
to stimulate alongside, i.e. excite to rivalry:--provoke to emulation (jealousy).
along the sea, i.e. maritime (lacustrine):--upon the sea coast.
to overlook or disregard:--neglect.
a deposit, i.e. (figuratively) trust:--committed unto.
to mispraise, i.e. recommend or advise (a different course):--admonish, exhort.

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and the middle voice of 154;
entryFree.def: to beg off, i.e. deprecate, decline, shun:--avoid, (make) excuse, intreat, refuse, reject.
to sit down near:--sit.
to call near, i.e. invite, invoke (by imploration, hortation or consolation):--beseech, call for, (be of good) comfort, desire, (give) exhort(-ation), intreat, pray.
to cover alongside, i.e. veil (figuratively):--hide.
something put down alongside, i.e. a deposit (sacred trust):--that (thing) which is committed (un-)to (trust).
to lie near, i.e. be at hand (figuratively, be prompt or easy):--be present.
imploration, hortation, solace:--comfort, consolation, exhortation, intreaty.
an intercessor, consoler:--advocate, comforter.
inattention, i.e. (by implication) disobedience:--disobedience.
to follow near, i.e. (figuratively) attend (as a result), trace out, conform to:--attain, follow, fully know, have understanding.
to mishear, i.e. (by implication) to disobey:--neglect to hear.
to bend beside, i.e. lean over (so as to peer within):--look (into), stoop down.
to receive near, i.e. associate with oneself (in any familiar or intimate act or relation); by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn:--receive, take (unto, with).

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and the middle voice of 3004 (in its original sense);
entryFree.def: (specially), to lay one's course near, i.e. sail past:--pass, sail by.
beside the salt (sea), i.e. maritime:--sea coast.
transmutation (of phase or orbit), i.e. (figuratively) fickleness:--variableness.
to misreckon, i.e. delude:--beguile, deceive.
as if dissolved, i.e. "paralytic":--that had (sick of) the palsy.
to loosen beside, i.e. relax (perfect passive participle, paralyzed or enfeebled):--feeble, sick of the (taken with) palsy.
to stay near, i.e. remain (literally, tarry; or figuratively, be permanent, persevere):--abide, continue.

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and the middle voice of a derivative of 3454;
entryFree.def: to relate near, i.e. (by implication) encourage, console:--comfort.
consolation (properly, abstract):--comfort.
consolation (properly, concretely):--comfort.
to be opposed to law, i.e. to transgress:--contrary to law.
transgression:--iniquity.
to embitter alongside, i.e. (figuratively) to exasperate:--provoke.
irritation:--provocation.
to fall aside, i.e. (figuratively) to apostatize:--fall away.
to sail near:--sail by.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 3844 and the base of 4139 (as adverb);
entryFree.def: close by, i.e. (figuratively) almost:--nigh unto.
in a manner near by, i.e. (figuratively) similarly:--likewise.
to travel near:--go, pass (by).
a side-slip (lapse or deviation), i.e. (unintentional) error or (wilful) transgression:--fall, fault, offence, sin, trespass.
to flow by, i.e. (figuratively) carelessly pass (miss):--let slip.
side-marked, i.e. labelled (with a badge (figure-head) of a ship):--sign.
to furnish aside, i.e. get ready:--prepare self, be (make) ready.
readiness:--preparation.
to extend along, i.e. prolong (in point of time):--continue.
to inspect alongside, i.e. note insidiously or scrupulously:--observe, watch.
inspection, i.e. ocular evidence:--obervation.
to place alongside, i.e. present (food, truth); by implication, to deposit (as a trust or for protection):--allege, commend, commit (the keeping of), put forth, set before.
to chance near, i.e. fall in with:--meet with.
at the very instant, i.e. momentary:--but for a moment.
to bear along or aside, i.e. carry off (literally or figuratively); by implication, to avert:--remove, take away.
to misthink, i.e. be insane (silly):--as a fool.
insanity, i.e. foolhardiness:--madness.
to winter near, i.e. stay with over the rainy season:--winter.
a wintering over:--winter in.
at the thing itself, i.e. instantly:--forthwith, immediately, presently, straightway, soon.
to be near, i.e. at hand; neuter present participle (singular) time being, or (plural) property:--come, X have, be here, + lack, (be here) present.
to lead in aside, i.e. introduce surreptitiously:--privily bring in.
smuggled in:--unawares brought in.

entryFree.etym: from 3844 and a compound of 1519 and 1416;
entryFree.def: to settle in alongside, i.e. lodge stealthily:--creep in unawares.
to come in alongside, i.e. supervene additionally or steathily:--come in privily, enter.
to bear in alongside, i.e. introduce simultaneously:--give.
near outside, i.e. besides:--except, saving, without.
a throwing in beside (juxtaposition), i.e. (specially), battle-array, encampment or barracks (tower Antonia):--army, camp, castle.
to harass further, i.e. annoy:--trouble.
an alien alongside, i.e. a resident foreigner:--pilgrim, stranger.
to come near or aside, i.e. to approach (arrive), go by (or away), (figuratively) perish or neglect, (causative) avert:--come (forth), go, pass (away, by, over), past, transgress.
praetermission, i.e. toleration:--remission.
to hold near, i.e. present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion:--bring, do, give, keep, minister, offer, shew, + trouble.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 3844 and a derivative of 58 (meaning to harangue an assembly);
entryFree.def: an address alongside, i.e. (specially), consolation:--comfort.
maidenhood:--virginity.
a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter:--virgin.
a Parthian, i.e. inhabitant of Parthia:--Parthian.
to let by, i.e. relax:--hang down.
a by-road, i.e. (actively) a route:--way.
to dwell near, i.e. reside as a foreigner:--sojourn in, be a stranger.
foreign residence:--sojourning, X as strangers.
having a home near, i.e. (as noun) a by-dweller (alien resident):--foreigner, sojourn, stranger.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 3844 and perhaps a derivative of 3633;
entryFree.def: apparently a state alongside of supposition, i.e. (concretely) an adage; specially, an enigmatical or fictitious illustration:--parable, proverb.
staying near wine, i.e. tippling (a toper):--given to wine.
to resemble:--be like unto.
alike nearly, i.e. similar:--like.
to sharpen alongside, i.e. (figuratively) to exasperate:--easily provoke, stir.
incitement (to good), or dispute (in anger):--contention, provoke unto.
to anger alongside, i.e. enrage:--anger, provoke to wrath.
rage:--wrath.
a being near, i.e. advent (often, return; specially, of Christ to punish Jerusalem, or finally the wicked); (by implication) physically, aspect:--coming, presence.
a side-dish (the receptacle):--platter.
all out-spokenness, i.e. frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance:--bold (X -ly, -ness, -ness of speech), confidence, X freely, X openly, X plainly(-ness).
to be frank in utterance, or confident in spirit and demeanor:--be (wax) bold, (preach, speak) boldly.

entryFree.etym: including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word;
entryFree.def: all, any, every, the whole:--all (manner of, means), alway(-s), any (one), X daily, + ever, every (one, way), as many as, + no(-thing), X thoroughly, whatsoever, whole, whosoever.
the Passover (the meal, the day, the festival or the special sacrifices connected with it):--Easter, Passover.
Patara, a place in Asia Minor:--Patara.

body.entryFree: πατάσσω patássō, pat-as'-so probably prolongation from 3817; to knock (gently or with a weapon or fatally):--smite, strike. Compare 5180.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative probably of 3817 (meaning a "path");
entryFree.def: to trample (literally or figuratively):--tread (down, under foot).
a "father" (literally or figuratively, near or more remote):--father, parent.
Patmus, an islet in the Mediterranean:--Patmos.

entryFree.etym: from 3962 and the same as the latter part of 3389;
entryFree.def: a parricide:--murderer of fathers.

entryFree.etym: as if feminine of a derivative of 3962;
entryFree.def: paternal descent, i.e. (concretely) a group of families or a whole race (nation):--family, kindred, lineage.
a progenitor ("patriarch"):--patriarch.
paternal, i.e. ancestral:--of fathers.
a father-land, i.e. native town; (figuratively) heavenly home:--(own) country.

entryFree.etym: from 3962 and a derivative of 3860 (in the sense of handing over or down);
entryFree.def: traditionary:--received by tradition from fathers.
paternal, i.e. hereditary:--of fathers.
(little; but remotely from a derivative of 3973, meaning the same); Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle:--Paul, Paulus.
to stop (transitively or intransitively), i.e. restrain, quit, desist, come to an end:--cease, leave, refrain.
Paphus, a place in Cyprus:--Paphos.
to thicken, i.e. (by implication) to fatten (figuratively, stupefy or render callous):--wax gross.
a shackle for the feet:--fetter.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of 4228 (meaning the ground);
entryFree.def: level (as easy for the feet):--plain.
to foot a journey, i.e. travel by land:--go afoot.

entryFree.etym: dative case feminine of a derivative of 4228 (as adverb);
entryFree.def: foot-wise, i.e. by walking:--a- (on) foot.
to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. (genitive case) to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice:--hearken, obey (magistrates).
persuasive:--enticing.

to convince (by argument, true or false); by analogy, to pacify or conciliate (by other fair means); reflexively or passively, to assent (to evidence or authority), to rely (by inward certainty):--agree, assure, believe, have confidence, be (wax) conflent, make friend, obey, persuade, trust, yield.

entryFree.etym: from the same as 3993 (through the idea of pinching toil; "pine");
entryFree.def: to famish (absolutely or comparatively); figuratively, to crave:--be an hungered.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4008 (through the idea of piercing);
entryFree.def: a test, i.e. attempt, experience:--assaying, trial.
to test (objectively), i.e. endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline:--assay, examine, go about, prove, tempt(-er), try.

to test (subjectively), i.e. (reflexively) to attempt:--assay.
persuadableness, i.e. credulity:--persuasion.
deep or open sea, i.e. the main:--depth, sea.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of 4141 (meaning an axe);
entryFree.def: to chop off (the head), i.e. truncate:--behead.
fifth:--fifth.

body.entryFree: PE/NHS πένης pénēs pen'-ace from a primary πένω pénō, (to toil for daily subsistence); starving, i.e. indigent:--poor. Compare 4434.

entryFree.def: a wife's mother:--mother in law, wife's mother.
a wife's father:--father in law.
to grieve (the feeling or the act):--mourn, (be-)wail.
grief:--mourning, sorrow.
necessitous:--poor.
five times:--five times.

"five":--five.
five and tenth:--fifteenth.
fifty:--fifty.
fiftieth (2250 being implied) from Passover, i.e. the festival of "Pentecost":--Pentecost.

entryFree.etym: from the perfect of the alternate of 3958;
entryFree.def: reliance:--confidence, trust.
an enclitic particle significant of abundance (thoroughness), i.e. emphasis; much, very or ever:--(whom-)soever.
an extremity:--end, ut-(ter-)most part.
fortified; Pergamus, a place in Asia Minor:--Pergamos.
a tower; Perga, a place in Asia Minor:--Perga.

body.entryFree: περί perí, per-ee' from the base of 4008; properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period):--(there-)about, above, against, at, on behalf of, X and his company, which concern, (as) concerning, for, X how it will go with, ((there-, where-)) of, on, over, pertaining (to), for sake, X (e-)state, (as) touching, (where-)by (in), with. In compounds, it retains substantially the same meaning of circuit (around), excess (beyond), or completeness (through).

entryFree.def: to take around (as a companion); reflexively, to walk around:--compass, go (round) about, lead about.
to remove all around, i.e. unveil, cast off (anchor); figuratively, to expiate:--take away (up).
to flash all around, i.e. envelop in light:--shine round (about).
to throw all around, i.e. invest (with a palisade or with clothing):--array, cast about, clothe(-d me), put on.
to look all around:--look (round) about (on).

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 4016;
entryFree.def: something thrown around one, i.e. a mantle, veil:--covering, vesture.
to bind around one, i.e. enwrap:--bind about.
to work all around, i.e. bustle about (meddle):--be a busybody.
working all around, i.e. officious (meddlesome, neuter plural magic):--busybody, curious arts.
to come all around, i.e. stroll, vacillate, veer:--fetch a compass, vagabond, wandering about.
to hold all around, i.e. include, clasp (figuratively):--+ astonished, contain, after (this manner).
to gird all around, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to fasten on one's belt (literally or figuratively):--gird (about, self).
a putting all around, i.e. decorating oneself with:--wearing.
to stand all around, i.e. (near) to be a bystander, or (aloof) to keep away from:--avoid, shun, stand by (round about).
something cleaned off all around, i.e. refuse (figuratively):--filth.
to cover all around, i.e. entirely (the face, a surface):--blindfold, cover, overlay.
to lie all around, i.e. inclose, encircle, hamper (literally or figuratively):--be bound (compassed) with, hang about.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a compound of 4012 and 2776;
entryFree.def: encirclement of the head, i.e. a helmet:--helmet.
strong all around, i.e. a master (manager):--+ come by.
to conceal all around, i.e. entirely:--hide.
to encircle all around, i.e. blockade completely:--compass round.
to illuminate all around, i.e. invest with a halo:--shine round about.
to leave all around, i.e. (passively) survive:--remain.
grieved all around, i.e. intensely sad:--exceeding (very) sorry(-owful).
to stay around, i.e. await:--wait for.
all around, i.e. (as an adjective) circumjacent:--round about.
to reside around, i.e. be a neighbor:--dwell round about.
housed around, i.e. neighboring (used elliptically as a noun):--neighbour.

entryFree.etym: from the present participle feminine of a compound of 4012 and 1510;
entryFree.def: being beyond usual, i.e. special (one's own):--peculiar.
a being held around, i.e. (concretely) a passage (of Scripture, as circumscribed):--place.
to tread all around, i.e. walk at large (especially as proof of ability); figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow (as a companion or votary):--go, be occupied with, walk (about).
to penetrate entirely, i.e. transfix (figuratively):--pierce through.
to fall into something that is all around, i.e. light among or upon, be surrounded with:--fall among (into).
to make around oneself, i.e. acquire (buy):--purchase.
acquisition (the act or the thing); by extension, preservation:--obtain(-ing), peculiar, purchased, possession, saving.
to tear all around, i.e. completely away:--rend off.
to drag all around, i.e. (figuratively) to distract (with care):--cumber.
surplusage, i.e. superabundance:--abundance(-ant, (-ly)), superfluity.
a surplus, or superabundance:--abundance, that was left, over and above.

to superabound (in quantity or quality), be in excess, be superfluous; also (transitively) to cause to superabound or excel:--(make, more) abound, (have, have more) abundance (be more) abundant, be the better, enough and to spare, exceed, excel, increase, be left, redound, remain (over and above).

superabundant (in quantity) or superior (in quality); by implication, excessive; adverbially (with 1537) violently; neuter (as noun) preeminence:--exceeding abundantly above, more abundantly, advantage, exceedingly, very highly, beyond measure, more, superfluous, vehement(-ly).
in a more superabundant way:--more abundantly, a great deal, far more.
more superabundant (in number, degree or character):--more abundant, greater (much) more, overmuch.
more superabundantly:--more abundant(-ly), X the more earnest, (more) exceedingly, more frequent, much more, the rather.
superabundantly:--exceedingly, out of measure, the more.
a pigeon:--dove, pigeon.
to cut around, i.e. (specially) to circumcise:--circumcise.
to place around; by implication, to present:--bestow upon, hedge round about, put about (on, upon), set about.
circumcision (the rite, the condition or the people, literally or figuratively):--X circumcised, circumcision.
to turn around, i.e. (mentally) to craze:--+ make mad.
to run around, i.e. traverse:--run through.
to convey around, i.e. transport hither and thither:--bear (carry) about.
to think beyond, i.e. depreciate (contemn):--despise.
around the region, i.e. circumjacent (as noun, with 1093 implied vicinity):--country (round) about, region (that lieth) round about.
a Persian woman; Persis, a Christian female:--Persis.
the by-gone, i.e. (as noun) last year:--+ a year ago.
a flying animal, i.e. bird:--bird, fowl.
a (mass of) rock (literally or figuratively):--rock.

body.entryFree: Πέτρος Pétros, pet'-ros apparently a primary word; a (piece of) rock (larger than 3037); as a name, Petrus, an apostle:--Peter, rock. Compare 2786.

entryFree.def: rock-like, i.e. rocky:--stony.
rue (from its thick or fleshy leaves):--rue.

entryFree.etym: probably from 4078 (through the idea of gushing plumply);
entryFree.def: a fount (literally or figuratively), i.e. source or supply (of water, blood, enjoyment) (not necessarily the original spring):--fountain, well.

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of a primary verb (which in its simpler form occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses);
entryFree.def: to fix ("peg"), i.e. (specially) to set up (a tent):--pitch.

entryFree.etym: a quantitative form (the feminine) of the base of 4225;
entryFree.def: how much (as an indefinite), i.e. in size or (figuratively) dignity:--how great (large).
clay:--clay.
a wallet or leather pouch for food:--scrip.
the fore-arm, i.e. (as a measure) a cubit:--cubit.

body.entryFree: πιάζω piázō, pee-ad'-zo probably another form of 971; to squeeze, i.e. seize (gently by the hand (press), or officially (arrest), or in hunting (capture)):--apprehend, catch, lay hand on, take. Compare 4085.

entryFree.def: to pack:--press down.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of a derivative of 3982 and 3056;
entryFree.def: persuasive language:--enticing words.
to embitter (literally or figuratively):--be (make) bitter.
acridity (especially poison), literally or figuratively:--bitterness.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from 4078 (through the idea of piercing);
entryFree.def: sharp (pungent), i.e. acrid (literally or figuratively):--bitter.
bitterly, i.e. (figuratively) violently:--bitterly.
close-pressed, i.e. firm; Pilatus, a Roman:--Pilate.
a tablet (for writing on):--writing table.
a plate:--charger, platter.
Pisidia, a region of Asia Minor:--Pisidia.

to have faith (in, upon, or with respect to, a person or thing), i.e. credit; by implication, to entrust (especially one's spiritual well-being to Christ):--believe(-r), commit (to trust), put in trust with.
trustworthy, i.e. genuine (unadulterated):--spike-(nard).

persuasion, i.e. credence; moral conviction (of religious truth, or the truthfulness of God or a religious teacher), especially reliance upon Christ for salvation; abstractly, constancy in such profession; by extension, the system of religious (Gospel) truth itself:--assurance, belief, believe, faith, fidelity.
objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful:--believe(-ing, -r), faithful(-ly), sure, true.
to assure:--assure of.
to (properly, cause to) roam (from safety, truth, or virtue):--go astray, deceive, err, seduce, wander, be out of the way.
objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety:--deceit, to deceive, delusion, error.
a rover ("planet"), i.e. (figuratively) an erratic teacher:--wandering.
roving (as a tramp), i.e. (by implication) an impostor or misleader;
a moulding-board, i.e. flat surface ("plate", or tablet, literally or figuratively):--table.
something moulded:--thing formed.
to mould, i.e. shape or fabricate:--form.
moulded, i.e. (by implication) artificial or (figuratively) fictitious (false):--feigned.
a wide "plat" or "place", i.e. open square:--street.
width:--breadth.
to widen (literally or figuratively):--make broad, enlarge.
spread out "flat" ("plot"), i.e. broad:--wide.
a plait (of hair):--broidered hair.
the largest number or very large:--very great, most.
to twine or braid:--plait.
to do, make or be more, i.e. increase (transitively or intransitively); by extension, to superabound:--abound, abundant, make to increase, have over.
to be covetous, i.e. (by implication) to over-reach:--get an advantage, defraud, make a gain.
holding (desiring) more, i.e. eager for gain (avaricious, hence a defrauder):--covetous.
avarice, i.e. (by implication) fraudulency, extortion:--covetous(-ness) practices, greediness.
a rib, i.e. (by extension) side:--side.
a stroke; by implication, a wound; figuratively, a calamity:--plague, stripe, wound(-ed).
a fulness, i.e. a large number, throng, populace:--bundle, company, multitude.
to increase (transitively or intransitively):--abound, multiply.
a smiter, i.e. pugnacious (quarrelsome):--striker.
flood-tide, i.e. (by analogy) a freshet:--flood.
moreover (besides), i.e. albeit, save that, rather, yet:--but (rather), except, nevertheless, notwithstanding, save, than.
replete, or covered over; by analogy, complete:--full.
to carry out fully (in evidence), i.e. completely assure (or convince), entirely accomplish:--most surely believe, fully know (persuade), make full proof of.
entire confidence:--(full) assurance.

to make replete, i.e. (literally) to cram (a net), level up (a hollow), or (figuratively) to furnish (or imbue, diffuse, influence), satisfy, execute (an office), finish (a period or task), verify (or coincide with a prediction), etc.:--accomplish, X after, (be) complete, end, expire, fill (up), fulfil, (be, make) full (come), fully preach, perfect, supply.

repletion or completion, i.e. (subjectively) what fills (as contents, supplement, copiousness, multitude), or (objectively) what is filled (as container, performance, period):--which is put in to fill up, piece that filled up, fulfilling, full, fulness.
a filling up, i.e. (figuratively) gratification:--satisfying.

body.entryFree: πλήσσω plḗssō, place'-so apparently another form of 4111 (through the idea of flattening out); to pound, i.e. (figuratively) to inflict with (calamity):--smite. Compare 5180.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 4143;
entryFree.def: a boat:--boat, little (small) ship.
a sailer, i.e. vessel:--ship(-ing).
a sail, i.e. navigation:--course, sailing, voyage.
wealthy; figuratively, abounding with:--rich.
copiously:--abundantly, richly.
to be (or become) wealthy (literally or figuratively):--be increased with goods, (be made, wax) rich.
to make wealthy (figuratively):--en- (make) rich.
wealth (as fulness), i.e. (literally) money, possessions, or (figuratively) abundance, richness, (specially), valuable bestowment:--riches.

body.entryFree: PLU/NW πλύνω plýnō ploo'-no a prolonged form of an obsolete πλύω plýō, (to "flow"); to "plunge", i.e. launder clothing:--wash. Compare 3068, 3538.

πνεῦμα pneûma, pnyoo'-mah from 4154; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christ's spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. Compare 5590.

πνευματικός pneumatikós, pnyoo-mat-ik-os' from 4151; non-carnal, i.e. (humanly) ethereal (as opposed to gross), or (dæmoniacally) a spirit (concretely), or (divinely) supernatural, regenerate, religious:--spiritual. Compare 5591.

entryFree.def: non-physically, i.e. divinely, figuratively:--spiritually.

body.entryFree: πνέω pnéō, pneh'-o a primary word; to breathe hard, i.e. breeze:--blow. Compare 5594.

entryFree.def: to wheeze, i.e. (causative, by implication) to throttle or strangle (drown):--choke, take by the throat.
throttled, i.e. (neuter concretely) an animal choked to death (not bled):--strangled.
respiration, a breeze:--breath, wind.

entryFree.etym: from 4228 and another element of uncertain affinity;
entryFree.def: a dress (2066 implied) reaching the ankles:--garment down to the foot.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4213 with enclitic adverb of origin;
entryFree.def: from which (as interrogative) or what (as relative) place, state, source or cause:--whence.

body.entryFree: ποιέω poiéō, poy-eh'-o apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do (in a very wide application, more or less direct):--abide, + agree, appoint, X avenge, + band together, be, bear, + bewray, bring (forth), cast out, cause, commit, + content, continue, deal, + without any delay, (would) do(-ing), execute, exercise, fulfil, gain, give, have, hold, X journeying, keep, + lay wait, + lighten the ship, make, X mean, + none of these things move me, observe, ordain, perform, provide, + have purged, purpose, put, + raising up, X secure, shew, X shoot out, spend, take, tarry, + transgress the law, work, yield. Compare 4238.

entryFree.def: a product, i.e. fabric (literally or figuratively):--thing that is made, workmanship.
action, i.e. performance (of the law):--deed.
a performer; specially, a "poet";
motley, i.e. various in character:--divers, manifold.
to tend as a shepherd of (figuratively, superviser):--feed (cattle), rule.
a shepherd (literally or figuratively):--shepherd, pastor.
a flock (literally or figuratively):--flock, fold.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 4167;
entryFree.def: a flock, i.e. (figuratively) group (of believers):--flock.
individualizing interrogative (of character) what sort of, or (of number) which one:--what (manner of), which.
to be (engaged) in warfare, i.e. to battle (literally or figuratively):--fight, (make) war.

entryFree.etym: probably from the same as 4171, or perhaps from 4183;
entryFree.def: a town (properly, with walls, of greater or less size):--city.
a town-officer, i.e. magistrate:--ruler of the city.
citizenship; concretely, a community:--commonwealth, freedom.
a community, i.e. (abstractly) citizenship (figuratively):--conversation.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of a derivative of 4177;
entryFree.def: to behave as a citizen (figuratively):--let conversation be, live.
a townsman:--citizen.
many times, i.e. frequently:--oft(-en, -entimes, -times).

entryFree.etym: from 4183 and probably a derivative of 4120;
entryFree.def: manifold, i.e. (neuter as noun) very much more:--manifold more.
loquacity, i.e. prolixity:--much speaking.

entryFree.etym: adverb from a compound of 4183 and 3313;
entryFree.def: in many portions, i.e. variously as to time and agency (piecemeal):--at sundry times.
much variegated, i.e. multifarious:--manifold.

body.entryFree: POLU/S πολύς polýs pol-oos' including the forms from the alternate πολλός pollós, ; (singular) much (in any respect) or (plural) many; neuter (singular) as adverbial, largely; neuter (plural) as adverb or noun often, mostly, largely:--abundant, + altogether, common, + far (passed, spent), (+ be of a) great (age, deal, -ly, while), long, many, much, oft(-en (-times)), plenteous, sore, straitly. Compare 4118, 4119.

entryFree.def: extremely compassionate:--very pitiful.
extremely expensive:--costly, very precious, of great price.
extremely valuable:--very costly, of great price.

entryFree.etym: adverb from a compound of 4183 and 5158;
entryFree.def: in many ways, i.e. variously as to method or form:--in divers manners.
a beverage:--drink.
depravity, i.e. (specially), malice; plural (concretely) plots, sins:--iniquity, wickedness.

body.entryFree: πονηρός ponērós, pon-ay-ros' from a derivative of 4192; hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from 2556, which refers rather to essential character, as well as from 4550, which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt; masculine (singular) the devil, or (plural) sinners:--bad, evil, grievous, harm, lewd, malicious, wicked(-ness). See also 4191.

entryFree.def: more evil:--more wicked.
toil, i.e. (by implication) anguish:--pain.
a Pontican, i.e. native of Pontus:--born in Pontus.
apparently bridged; Pontius, a Roman:--Pontius.
a sea; Pontus, a region of Asia Minor:--Pontus.
apparently "popular"; Poplius (i.e. Publius), a Roman:--Publius.
travel (by land); figuratively (plural) proceedings, i.e. career:--journey(-ing), ways.

entryFree.etym: middle voice from a derivative of the same as 3984;
entryFree.def: to traverse, i.e. travel (literally or figuratively; especially to remove (figuratively, die), live, etc.);
entryFree.seg: --depart, go (away, forth, one's way, up), (make a, take a) journey, walk.

entryFree.def: apparently swinish; Porcius, a Roman:--Porcius.
harlotry (including adultery and incest); figuratively, idolatry:--fornication.
to act the harlot, i.e. (literally) indulge unlawful lust (of either sex), or (figuratively) practise idolatry:--commit (fornication).
a strumpet; figuratively, an idolater:--harlot, whore.

body.entryFree: πόῤῥω pórrhō, por'-rho adverb from 4253; forwards, i.e. at a distance:--far, a great way off. See also 4207.

entryFree.etym: from 4206 with adverbial enclitic of source;
entryFree.def: from far, or (by implication) at a distance, i.e. distantly:--afar off.
further, i.e. a greater distance:--farther.
the "purple" mussel, i.e. (by implication) the red-blue color itself, and finally a garment dyed with it:--purple.
purpureal, i.e. bluish red:--purple.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a compound of 4209 and 4453;
entryFree.def: a female trader in purple cloth:--seller of purple.
how many times:--how oft(-en).
a drinking (the act), i.e. (concretely) a draught:--drink.

entryFree.etym: probably from a derivative of the alternate of 4095 (compare 4224);
entryFree.def: a current, brook or freshet (as drinkable), i.e. running water:--flood, river, stream, water.
river-borne, i.e. overwhelmed by a stream:--carried away of the flood.

entryFree.etym: apparently from 4219 and the base of 4226;
entryFree.def: interrogatively, whatever, i.e. of what possible sort:--what (manner of).
indefinite adverb, at some time, ever:--afore-(any, some-)time(-s), at length (the last), (+ n- )ever, in the old time, in time past, once, when.
interrogative adverb, at what time:--+ how long, when.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a comparative of the base of 4226;
entryFree.def: interrogative as adverb, which (of two), i.e. is it this or that:--whether.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a derivative of the alternate of 4095;
entryFree.def: a drinking-vessel; by extension, the contents thereof, i.e. a cupful (draught); figuratively, a lot or fate:--cup.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the alternate of 4095;
entryFree.def: to furnish drink, irrigate:--give (make) to drink, feed, water.
little wells, i.e. mineral springs; Potioli (i.e. Puteoli), a place in Italy:--Puteoli.
a drinking-bout or carousal:--banqueting.
modest; Pudes (i.e. Pudens), a Christian:--Pudens.
a "foot" (figuratively or literally):--foot(-stool).
a deed; by implication, an affair; by extension, an object (material):--business, matter, thing, work.
a transaction, i.e. negotiation:--affair.
to busy oneself with, i.e. to trade:--occupy.
the prætorium or governor's courtroom (sometimes including the whole edifice and camp):--(common, judgment) hall (of judgment), palace, prætorium.
a practiser, i.e. (specially), an official collector:--officer.
practice, i.e. (concretely) an act; by extension, a function:--deed, office, work.

entryFree.etym: a form of 4239, used in certain parts;
entryFree.def: gentle, i.e. humble:--meek.
gentleness, by implication, humility:--meekness.

to "practise", i.e. perform repeatedly or habitually (thus differing from 4160, which properly refers to a single act); by implication, to execute, accomplish, etc.; specially, to collect (dues), fare (personally):--commit, deeds, do, exact, keep, require, use arts.

body.entryFree: πραΰς praÿs, prah-ooce' apparently a primary word; mild, i.e. (by implication) humble:--meek. See also 4235.

entryFree.def: mildness, i.e. (by implication) humility:--meekness.
to tower up (be conspicuous), i.e. (by implication) to be suitable or proper (third person singular present indicative, often used impersonally, it is fit or right):--become, comely.
seniority (eldership), i.e. (by implication) an embassy (concretely, ambassadors):--ambassage, message.
to be a senior, i.e. (by implication) act as a representative (figuratively, preacher):--be an ambassador.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 4245;
entryFree.def: the order of elders, i.e. (specially), Israelite Sanhedrin or Christian "presbytery":--(estate of) elder(-s), presbytery.
an old man:--aged (man), old man.
an old woman:--aged woman.
leaning (falling) forward ("prone"), i.e. head foremost:--headlong.

entryFree.etym: a strengthened form of a primary prio (to saw);
entryFree.def: to saw in two:--saw asunder.
prior, sooner:--before (that), ere.

body.entryFree: Πρίσκα Príska, pris'-kah of Latin origin; feminine of Priscus, ancient; Priska, a Christian woman:--Prisca. See also 4252.

entryFree.def: Priscilla (i.e. little Prisca), a Christian woman:--Priscilla.

body.entryFree: πρό pró, pro a primary preposition; "fore", i.e. in front of, prior (figuratively, superior) to:--above, ago, before, or ever. In the compounds, it retains the same significations.

entryFree.def: to lead forward (magisterially); intransitively, to precede (in place or time [particle previous]):--bring (forth, out), go before.
to choose for oneself before another thing (prefer), i.e. (by implication) to propose (intend):--purpose.
to accuse already, i.e. previously charge:--prove before.
to hear already,i.e. anticipate:--hear before.
to sin previously (to conversion):--sin already, heretofore sin.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed compound of 4253 and 833;
entryFree.def: a forecourt, i.e. vestibule (alley-way):--porch.
to walk forward, i.e. advance (literally, or in years):--+ be of a great age, go farther (on), be well stricken.
to throw forward, i.e. push to the front, germinate:--put forward, shoot forth.
relating to sheep, i.e. (a gate) through which they were led into Jerusalem:--sheep (market).

entryFree.etym: probably neuter of a presumed derivative of 4260;
entryFree.def: something that walks forward (a quadruped), i.e. (specially), a sheep (literally or figuratively):--sheep(-fold).

entryFree.etym: from 4253 and a reduplicated form of 971;
entryFree.def: to force forward, i.e. bring to the front, instigate:--draw, before instruct.
to look out beforehand, i.e. furnish in advance:--provide.
to be already, i.e. have previousy transpired:--be past.
to know beforehand, i.e. foresee:--foreknow (ordain), know (before).
forethought:--foreknowledge.
an ancestor, (grand-)parent:--forefather, parent.
to write previously; figuratively, to announce, prescribe:--before ordain, evidently set forth, write (afore, aforetime).
plain before all men, i.e. obvious:--evident, manifest (open) beforehand.
to give before the other party has given:--first give.

entryFree.etym: from 4272 (in the sense of giving forward into another's (the enemy's) hands);
entryFree.def: a surrender:--betrayer, traitor.
a runner ahead, i.e. scout (figuratively, precursor):--forerunner.
foresee:--foresee, saw before.
to hope in advance of other confirmation:--first trust.

body.entryFree: προέπω proépō, pro-ep'-o from 4253 and 2036; to say already, to predict:--forewarn, say (speak, tell) before. Compare 4280.

entryFree.def: to commence already:--begin (before).
to promise of old:--promise before.
used as alternate of 4277; to say already, predict:--foretell, say (speak, tell) before.
to go onward, precede (in place or time):--go before (farther, forward), outgo, pass on.
to fit up in advance (literally or figuratively):--ordain before, prepare afore.
to announce glad news in advance:--preach before the gospel.
to hold oneself before others, i.e. (figuratively) to excel:--be better.
to lead the way for others, i.e. show deference:--prefer.
a setting forth, i.e. (figuratively) proposal (intention); specially, the show-bread (in the Temple) as exposed before God:--purpose, shew(-bread).
fixed beforehand, i.e. (feminine with 2250 implied) a designated day:--time appointed.
predisposition, i.e. alacrity:--forwardness of mind, readiness (of mind), ready (willing) mind.
forward in spirit, i.e. predisposed; neuter (as noun) alacrity:--ready, willing.
with alacrity:--willingly.
to stand before, i.e. (in rank) to preside, or (by implication) to practise:--maintain, be over, rule.
to call forth to oneself (challenge), i.e. (by implication) to irritate:--provoke.
to anounce beforehand, i.e. predict, promise:--foretell, have notice, (shew) before.
to prepare in advance:--make up beforehand.
to lie before the view, i.e. (figuratively) to be present (to the mind), to stand forth (as an example or reward):--be first, set before (forth).
to herald (i.e. proclaim) in advance:--before (first) preach.
progress, i.e. advancement (subjectively or objectively):--furtherance, profit.
to drive forward (as if by beating), i.e. (figuratively and intransitively) to advance (in amount, to grow; in time, to be well along):--increase, proceed, profit, be far spent, wax.
a prejudgment (prejudice), i.e. prepossession:--prefer one before another.
to ratify previously:--confirm before.
to take in advance, i.e. (literally) eat before others have an opportunity; (figuratively) to anticipate, surprise:--come aforehand, overtake, take before.
to say beforehand, i.e. predict, forewarn:--foretell, tell before.
to be a witness in advance i.e. predict:--testify beforehand.
to premeditate:--meditate before.
to care (anxiously) in advance:--take thought beforehand.
to consider in advance, i.e. look out for beforehand (actively, by way of maintenance for others; middle voice by way of circumspection for oneself):--provide (for).
forethought, i.e. provident care or supply:--providence, provision.
to behold in advance, i.e. (actively) to notice (another) previously, or (middle voice) to keep in (one's own) view:--foresee, see before.
to limit in advance, i.e. (figuratively) predetermine:--determine before, ordain, predestinate.
to undergo hardship previously:--suffer before.
to send forward, i.e. escort or aid in travel:--accompany, bring (forward) on journey (way), conduct forth.
falling forward, i.e. headlong (figuratively, precipitate):--heady, rash(-ly).
to precede (as guide or herald):--go before.

body.entryFree: πρός prós, pros a strengthened form of 4253; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the compound case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at.
προσάββατον prosábbaton, pros-ab'-bat-on from 4253 and 4521; a fore-sabbath, i.e. the Sabbath-eve:--day before the sabbath. Compare 3904.

entryFree.etym: from 4314 and a derivative of 58 (mean to harangue);
entryFree.def: to address, i.e. salute by name:--call.
to lead towards, i.e. (transitively) to conduct near (summon, present), or (intransitively) to approach:--bring, draw near.
admission:--access.
to ask repeatedly (importune), i.e. solicit:--beg.
to ascend farther, i.e. be promoted (take an upper (more honorable) seat):--go up.
to expend further:--spend.
to fill up further, i.e. furnish fully:--supply.
to lay up in addition, i.e. (middle voice and figuratively) to impart or (by implication) to consult:--in conference add, confer.

body.entryFree: προσαπειλέω prosapeiléō, pros-ap-i-leh'-o from 4314 and 546; to menace additionally:--i. e. threaten further.

entryFree.def: to expend additionally:--spend more.
to require additionally, i.e. want further:--need.
to admit (to intercourse, hospitality, credence, or (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await (with confidence or patience):--accept, allow, look (wait) for, take.
to anticipate (in thought, hope or fear); by implication, to await:--(be in) expect(-ation), look (for), when looked, tarry, wait for.
apprehension (of evil); by implication, infliction anticipated:--expectation, looking after.
to permit further progress:--suffer.
to approach near:--come nigh.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 4314 and the base of 1476;
entryFree.def: to sit near, i.e. attend as a servant:--wait at.
to work additionally, i.e. (by implication) acquire besides:--gain.
to approach, i.e. (literally) come near, visit, or (figuratively) worship, assent to:--(as soon as he) come (unto), come thereunto, consent, draw near, go (near, to, unto).
prayer (worship); by implication, an oratory (chapel):--X pray earnestly, prayer.
to pray to God, i.e. supplicate, worship:--pray (X earnestly, for), make prayer.

(figuratively) to hold the mind (3563 implied) towards, i.e. pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to:--(give) attend(-ance, -ance at, -ance to, unto), beware, be given to, give (take) heed (to unto); have regard.
to peg to, i.e. spike fast:--nail to.
an arriver from a foreign region, i.e. (specially), an acceder (convert) to Judaism ("proselyte"):--proselyte.
for the occasion only, i.e. temporary:--dur-(eth) for awhile, endure for a time, for a season, temporal.
to call toward oneself, i.e. summon, invite:--call (for, to, unto).

to be earnest towards, i.e. (to a thing) to persevere, be constantly diligent, or (in a place) to attend assiduously all the exercises, or (to a person) to adhere closely to (as a servitor):--attend (give self) continually (upon), continue (in, instant in, with), wait on (continually).
persistancy:--perseverance.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed compound of 4314 and 2776;
entryFree.def: something for the head, i.e. a cushion:--pillow.
to give a common lot to, i.e. (figuratively) to associate with:--consort with.
a leaning towards, i.e. (figuratively) proclivity (favoritism):--partiality.
to glue to, i.e. (figuratively) to adhere:--cleave, join (self).
a stub, i.e. (figuratively) occasion of apostasy:--offence, stumbling(-block, (-stone)).
a stumbling, i.e. (figuratively and concretely) occasion of sin:--offence.
to strike at, i.e. surge against (as water); specially, to stub on, i.e. trip up (literally or figuratively):--beat upon, dash, stumble (at).
to roll towards, i.e. block against:--roll (to).

entryFree.etym: from 4314 and a probable derivative of 2965 (meaning to kiss, like a dog licking his master's hand);
entryFree.def: to fawn or crouch to, i.e. (literally or figuratively) prostrate oneself in homage (do reverence to, adore):--worship.
an adorer:--worshipper.
to talk to, i.e. converse with:--speak to (with).
to take to oneself, i.e. use (food), lead (aside), admit (to friendship or hospitality):--receive, take (unto).
admission:--receiving.
to stay further, i.e. remain in a place, with a person; figuratively, to adhere to, persevere in:--abide still, be with, cleave unto, continue in (with).

entryFree.etym: from 4314 and a derivative of the same as 3730 (meaning to tie (anchor) or lull);
entryFree.def: to moor to, i.e. (by implication) land at:--draw to the shore.
to be indebted additionally:--over besides.
hungering further, i.e. intensely hungry:--very hungry.
to fasten to, i.e. (specially), to impale (on a cross):--crucify.
to fall towards, i.e. (gently) prostrate oneself (in supplication or homage), or (violently) to rush upon (in storm):--beat upon, fall (down) at (before).
to do forward for oneself, i.e. pretend (as if about to do a thing):--make as though.
to journey towards, i.e. approach (not the same as 4313):--go before.
to tear towards, i.e. burst upon (as a tempest or flood):--beat vehemently against (upon).
to arrange towards, i.e. (figuratively) enjoin:--bid, command.
a patroness, i.e. assistant:--succourer.
to place additionally, i.e. lay beside, annex, repeat:--add, again, give more, increase, lay unto, proceed further, speak to any more.
to run towards, i.e. hasten to meet or join:--run (thither to, to).

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of a compound of 4314 and 5315;
entryFree.def: something eaten in addition to bread, i.e. a relish (specially, fish; compare 3795):--meat.
previously (recently) slain (fresh), i.e. (figuratively) lately made:--new.
recently:--lately.

body.entryFree: ‐πώς -pṓs, poce adverb from the base of 4225; an enclitic particle of indefiniteness of manner; somehow or anyhow; used only in composition:--haply, by any (some) means, perhaps. See 1513, 3381. Compare 4459.

πῶς pōs, poce adverb from the base of 4226; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way? (sometimes the question is indirect, how?); also as exclamation, how much!:--how, after (by) what manner (means), that. (Occasionally unexpressed in English).

more speedily, i.e. sooner than otherwise:--more carefully.
earnestly, promptly:--diligently, instantly.
"speed", i.e. (by implication) despatch, eagerness, earnestness:--business, (earnest) care(-fulness), diligence, forwardness, haste.
a hamper or lunch-receptacle:--basket.
a jar or earthen tank:--pot.
a standing (properly, the act), i.e. (by analogy) position (existence); by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy:--dissension, insurrection, X standing, uproar.
a stander (standard of value), i.e. (specially), a stater or certain coin:--piece of money.

a stake or post (as set upright), i.e. (specially), a pole or cross (as an instrument of capital punishment); figuratively, exposure to death, i.e. self-denial; by implication, the atonement of Christ:--cross.
to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish (subdue) passion or selfishness:--crucify.
a cluster of grapes (as if intertwined):--grapes.
a head of grain (as standing out from the stalk):--ear (of corn).
Stachys, a Christian:--Stachys.
to roof over, i.e. (figuratively) to cover with silence (endure patiently):--(for-)bear, suffer.

entryFree.etym: a contraction from 4731 (as stiff and unnatural);
entryFree.def: "sterile":--barren.

entryFree.etym: probably strengthened from the base of 2476;
entryFree.def: properly, to set fast ("stall"), i.e. (figuratively) to repress (reflexively, abstain from associating with):--avoid, withdraw self.
a wreath for show:--garland.
a sigh:--groaning.
to make (intransitively, be) in straits, i.e. (by implication) to sigh, murmur, pray inaudibly:--with grief, groan, grudge, sigh.
narrow (from obstacles standing close about):--strait.
to hem in closely, i.e. (figuratively) cramp:--distress, straiten.
narrowness of room, i.e. (figuratively) calamity:--anguish, distress.
stiff, i.e. solid, stable (literally or figuratively):--stedfast, strong, sure.
to solidify, i.e. confirm (literally or figuratively):--establish, receive strength, make strong.
something established, i.e. (abstractly) confirmation (stability):--stedfastness.
Stephanus, a Christian:--Stephen.
to adorn with an honorary wreath (literally or figuratively):--crown.
the (entire external) bosom, i.e. chest:--breast.
to be stationary, i.e. (figuratively) to persevere:--stand (fast).
stability (figuratively):--stedfastness.
to set fast, i.e. (literally) to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or (figuratively) to confirm:--fix, (e-)stablish, stedfastly set, strengthen.
a point of time, i.e. an instant:--moment.
to gleam, i.e. flash intensely:--shining.
a colonnade or interior piazza:--porch.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of 4748;
entryFree.def: something orderly in arrangement, i.e. (by implication) a serial (basal, fundamental, initial) constituent (literally), proposition (figuratively):--element, principle, rudiment.
equipment, i.e. (specially), a "stole" or long-fitting gown (as a mark of dignity):--long clothing (garment), (long) robe.

entryFree.etym: probably strengthened from a presumed derivative of the base of 5114;
entryFree.def: the mouth (as if a gash in the face); by implication, language (and its relations); figuratively, an opening (in the earth); specially, the front or edge (of a weapon):--edge, face, mouth.
an orifice (the gullet), i.e. (specially), the "stomach":--stomach.
military service, i.e. (figuratively) the apostolic career (as one of hardship and danger):--warfare.
an armament, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops (more or less extensive or systematic):--army, soldier, man of war.

entryFree.etym: middle voice from the base of 4756;
entryFree.def: to serve in a military campaign; figuratively, to execute the apostolate (with its arduous duties and functions), to contend with carnal inclinations:--soldier, (go to) war(-fare).

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4756 and 71 or 2233;
entryFree.def: a general, i.e. (by implication or analogy) a (military) governor (prætor), the chief (præfect) of the (Levitical) temple-wardens:--captain, magistrate.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed derivative of the same as 4756;
entryFree.def: a camper-out, i.e. a (common) warrior (literally or figuratively):--soldier.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of the base of 4756 and 3004 (in its original sense);
entryFree.def: to gather (or select) as a warrior, i.e. enlist in the army:--choose to be a soldier.
a ruler of an army, i.e. (specially), a Prætorian præfect:--captain of the guard.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4756 and the same as 3977;
entryFree.def: a camping-ground, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops:--army.
to wrench, i.e. (specially), to torture (by the rack), but only figuratively, to pervert:-- wrest.
to twist, i.e. turn quite around or reverse (literally or figuratively):--convert, turn (again, back again, self, self about).
to be luxurious:--live deliciously.
a "straining", "strenuousness" or "strength", i.e. (figuratively) luxury (voluptuousness):--delicacy.
to render gloomy, i.e. (by implication) glower (be overcast with clouds, or sombreness of speech):--lower, be sad.
a "Stoic" (as occupying a particular porch in Athens), i.e. adherent of a certin philosophy:--Stoick.

body.entryFree: σύ sý, soo the personal pronoun of the second person singular; thou:-- thou. See also 4571, 4671, 4675; and for the plural 5209, 5210, 5213, 5216.

entryFree.def: relationship, i.e. (concretely) relatives:--kindred.
a relative (by blood); by extension, a fellow countryman:--cousin, kin(-sfolk, -sman).
fellow knowledge, i.e. concession:--permission.
to seat oneself in company with:--sit with.
to give (or take) a seat in company with:--(make) sit (down) together.
to suffer hardship in company with:--be partaker of afflictions.
to maltreat in company with, i.e. (passively) endure persecution together:--suffer affliction with.
to convoke:--call together.
to conceal altogether:--cover.
to bend together, i.e. (figuratively) to afflict:--bow down.
to descend in company with:--go down with.
a deposition (of sentiment) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) accord with:--agreement.
to deposit (one's vote or opinion) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to accord with:--consent.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a compound of 2596 and 5585;
entryFree.def: to count down in company with, i.e. enroll among:--number with.
to commingle, i.e. (figuratively) to combine or assimilate:--mix with, temper together.
to move together, i.e. (specially), to excite as a mass (to sedition):--stir up.
to shut together, i.e. include or (figuratively) embrace in a common subjection to:--conclude, inclose, shut up.
a co-heir, i.e. (by analogy) participant in common:--fellow (joint)-heir, heir together, heir with.
to share in company with, i.e. co-participate in:--communicate (have fellowship) with, be partaker of.
a co-participant:--companion, partake(-r, -r with).
to convey together, i.e. collect or bear away in company with others:--carry.

to judge of one thing in connection with another, i.e. combine (spiritual ideas with appropriate expressions) or collate (one person with another by way of contrast or resemblance):--compare among (with).
to stoop altogether, i.e. be completely overcome by:--bow together.
to sympathize in gladness, congratulate:--rejoice in (with).
to use jointly, i.e. (by implication) to hold intercourse in common:--have dealings with.
commixture, i.e. (figuratively) riotous disturbance:--confusion.
to continue to live in common with, i.e. co-survive (literally or figuratively):--live with.
to yoke together, i.e. (figuratively) conjoin (in marriage):--join together.
to investigate jointly, i.e. discuss, controvert, cavil:--dispute (with), enquire, question (with), reason (together).
mutual questioning, i.e. discussion:--disputation(-ting), reasoning.
a disputant, i.e. sophist:--disputer.
co-yoked, i.e. (figuratively) as noun, a colleague; probably rather as a proper name; Syzygus, a Christian:--yokefellow.
to reanimate conjointly with (figuratively):--quicken together with.

entryFree.etym: of Hebrew origin [08256] in imitation of 4809;
entryFree.def: a sycamore-fig tree:--sycamine tree.
a fig-tree:--fig tree.

body.entryFree: SUKOMWRAI/A συκομωραία sykomōraía soo-kom-o-rah'-yah from 4810 and μόρον móron, (the mulberry); the "sycamore"-fig tree:--sycamore tree. Compare 4807.

entryFree.def: a fig:--fig.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 4810 and a derivative of 5316;
entryFree.def: to be a fig-informer (reporter of the law forbidding the exportation of figs from Greece), "sycophant", i.e. (genitive and by extension) to defraud (exact unlawfully, extort):--accuse falsely, take by false accusation.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4813 and (the reduplicated form of) 71;
entryFree.def: to lead away as booty, i.e. (figuratively) seduce:--spoil.
to talk together, i.e. converse:--commune (confer, talk) with, speak among.
to clasp, i.e. seize (arrest, capture); specially, to conceive (literally or figuratively); by implication, to aid:--catch, conceive, help, take.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and 3004 in its original sense;
entryFree.def: to collect:--gather (together, up).
to reckon together (with oneself), i.e. deliberate:--reason with.
to afflict jointly, i.e. (passive) sorrow at (on account of) someone:--be grieved.
to walk (figuratively, transpire) together, i.e. concur (take place):--be(-fall), happen (unto).
to combine, i.e. (in speaking) to converse, consult, dispute, (mentally) to consider, (by implication) to aid, (personally) to join, attack:--confer, encounter, help, make, meet with, ponder.
to be co-regent (figuratively):--reign with.
to give (or take) advice jointly, i.e. recommend, deliberate or determine:--consult, (give, take) counsel (together).

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of 4825;
entryFree.def: advisement; specially, a deliberative body, i.e. the provincial assessors or lay-court:--consultation, counsel, council.
a consultor, i.e. adviser:--counsellor.
Symeon (i.e. Shimon), the name of five Israelites:--Simeon, Simon.
a co-learner (of Christianity):--fellow disciple.
to testify jointly, i.e. corroborate by (concurrent) evidence:--testify unto, (also) bear witness (with).
to share jointly, i.e. participate in:--be partaker with.
a co-participant:--partaker.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed compound of 4862 and 3401;
entryFree.def: a co-imitator, i.e. fellow votary:--follower together.
jointly formed, i.e. (figuratively) similar:--conformed to, fashioned like unto.
to render like, i.e. (figuratively) to assimilate:--make conformable unto.
to feel "sympathy" with, i.e. (by implication) to commiserate:--have compassion, be touched with a feeling of.
having a fellow-feeling ("sympathetic"), i.e. (by implication) mutually commiserative:--having compassion one of another.
to be present together, i.e. to convene; by implication, to appear in aid:--come together, stand with.
to console jointly:--comfort together.
to take along in company:--take with.
to remain in company, i.e. still live:--continue with.
to be at hand together, i.e. now present:--be here present with.
to experience pain jointly or of the same kind (specially, persecution; to "sympathize"):--suffer with.
to despatch in company:--send with.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a compound of 4012 and 2983;
entryFree.def: to take by enclosing altogether, i.e. earnestly throw the arms about one:--embrace.
to partake a beverage in company:--drink with.
to implenish completely, i.e. (of space) to swamp (a boat), or (of time) to accomplish (passive, be complete):--(fully) come, fill up.
to strangle completely, i.e. (literally) to drown, or (figuratively) to crowd:--choke, throng.
a native of the same town, i.e. (figuratively) co-religionist (fellow-Christian):--fellow- citizen.
to journey together; by implication, to assemble:--go with, resort.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a derivative of the alternate of 4844;
entryFree.def: a drinking-party ("symposium"), i.e. (by extension) a room of guests:--company.
a co-presbyter:--presbyter, also an elder.

to bear together (contribute), i.e. (literally) to collect, or (figuratively) to conduce; especially (neuter participle as a noun) advantage:--be better for, bring together, be expedient (for), be good, (be) profit(-able for).
to say jointly, i.e. assent to:--consent unto.
a co-tribesman, i.e. native of the same country:--countryman.
grown along with (connate), i.e. (figuratively) closely united to:--planted together.
passive, to grow jointly:--spring up with.
to be harmonious, i.e. (figuratively) to accord (be suitable, concur) or stipulate (by compact):--agree (together, with).
accordance:--concord.
unison of sound ("symphony"), i.e. a concert of instruments (harmonious note):--music.
sounding together (alike), i.e. (figuratively) accordant (neuter as noun, agreement):-- consent.
to compute jointly:--reckon.
co-spirited, i.e. similar in sentiment:--like-minded.

body.entryFree: σύν sýn, soon a primary preposition denoting union; with or together (but much closer than 3326 or 3844), i.e. by association, companionship, process, resemblance, possession, instrumentality, addition, etc.:--beside, with. In composition it has similar applications, including completeness.

entryFree.def: to lead together, i.e. collect or convene; specially, to entertain (hospitably):--+ accompany, assemble (selves, together), bestow, come together, gather (selves together, up, together), lead into, resort, take in.
an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish "synagogue" (the meeting or the place); by analogy, a Christian church:--assembly, congregation, synagogue.
to struggle in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to be a partner (assistant):--strive together with.
to wrestle in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to seek jointly:--labour with, strive together for.
to make up together, i.e. (figuratively) to compute (an account):--reckon, take.
a co-captive:--fellowprisoner.
to accompany:--follow.
to ascend in company with:--come up with.
to recline in company with (at a meal):--sit (down, at the table, together) with (at meat).

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a compound of 303 and 3396;
entryFree.def: to mix up together, i.e. (figurative) associate with:--(have, keep) company (with).
to recruit oneself in company with:--refresh with.
to meet with; figuratively, to occur:--befall, meet.
a meeting with:--meet.
to take hold of opposite together, i.e. co-operate (assist):--help.
to take off together, i.e. transport with (seduce, passively, yield):--carry (lead) away with, condescend.
to decease (literally) in company with, or (figuratively), similarly to:--be dead (die) with.
to destroy (middle voice or passively, be slain) in company with:--perish with.
to despatch (on an errand) in company with:--send with.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a derivative of a compound of 719 and 3004 (in its original sense of laying);
entryFree.def: to render close-jointed together, i.e. organize compactly:--be fitly framed (joined) together.
to snatch together, i.e. seize:--catch.
to increase (grow up) together:--grow together.
a joint tie, i.e. ligament, (figuratively) uniting principle, control:--band, bond.
to bind with, i.e. (passively) be a fellow-prisoner (figuratively):--be bound with.
to exalt to dignity in company (i.e. similarly) with:--glorify together.
a co-slave, i.e. servitor or ministrant of the same master (human or divine):--fellowservant.
a running together, i.e. (riotous) concourse:--run together.
to rouse (from death) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to revivify (spirtually) in resemblance to:--raise up together, rise with.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of a compound of 4862 and the base of 1476;
entryFree.def: a joint session, i.e. (specially), the Jewish Sanhedrin; by analogy, a subordinate tribunal:--council.
co-perception, i.e. moral consciousness:--conscience.

to see completely; used (like its primary) only in two past tenses, respectively meaning to understand or become aware, and to be conscious or (clandestinely) informed of:--consider, know, be privy, be ware of.
to be in company with, i.e. present at the time:--be with.
to enter in company with:--go in with, go with into.
a co-absentee from home, i.e. fellow-traveller:--companion in travel, travel with.
chosen in company with, i.e. co-elect (fellow Christian):--elected together with.
to drive together, i.e. (figuratively) exhort (to reconciliation):--+ set at one again.
to testify further jointly, i.e. unite in adding evidence:--also bear witness.
to be a fellow-worker, i.e. co-operate:--help (work) with, work(-er) together.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed compound of 4862 and the base of 2041;
entryFree.def: a co-laborer, i.e. coadjutor:--companion in labour, (fellow-)helper(-labourer, -worker), labourer together with, workfellow.
to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or (specially), cohabit (conjugally):--accompany, assemble (with), come (together), come (company, go) with, resort.
to take food in company with:--eat with.
a mental putting together, i.e. intelligence or (concretely) the intellect:--knowledge, understanding.

body.entryFree: συνετός synetós, soon-et'-os from 4920; mentally put (or putting) together, i.e. sagacious:--prudent. Compare 5429.

entryFree.def: to think well of in common, i.e. assent to, feel gratified with:--allow, assent, be pleased, have pleasure.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a derivative of a presumed compound of 2095 and a derivative of 2192 (meaning to be in good condition, i.e. (by implication) to fare well, or feast);
entryFree.def: to entertain sumptuously in company with, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to revel together:--feast with.
to stand up together, i.e. to resist (or assault) jointly:--rise up together.

to hold together, i.e. to compress (the ears, with a crowd or siege) or arrest (a prisoner); figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy:--constrain, hold, keep in, press, lie sick of, stop, be in a strait, straiten, be taken with, throng.

entryFree.etym: middle voice from 4862 and the base of 2237;
entryFree.def: to rejoice in with oneself, i.e. feel satisfaction concerning:--delight.
mutual habituation, i.e. usage:--custom.
a co-aged person, i.e. alike in years:--equal.
to inter in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to assimilate spiritually (to Christ by a sepulture as to sin):--bury with.
to dash together, i.e. shatter:--break.
to compress, i.e. crowd on all sides:--throng.
to travel in company with:--journey with.
companionship on a journey, i.e. (by implication), a caravan:--company.
to reside together (as a family):--dwell together.
to construct, i.e. (passively) to compose (in company with other Christians, figuratively):--build together.
to converse mutually:--talk with.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a derivative of a compound of the base of 3674 and the base of 3725;
entryFree.def: to border together, i.e. adjoin:--join hard.
restraint, i.e. (figuratively) anxiety:--anguish, distress.
to arrange jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to direct:--appoint.
entire completion, i.e. consummation (of a dispensation):--end.
to complete entirely; generally, to execute (literally or figuratively):--end, finish, fulfil, make.
to contract by cutting, i.e. (figuratively) do concisely (speedily):--(cut) short.
to keep closely together, i.e. (by implication) to conserve (from ruin); mentally, to remember (and obey):--keep, observe, preserve.
to place jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to consent (bargain, stipulate), concur:--agree, assent, covenant.
concisely (briefly):--a few words.
to rush together (hastily assemble) or headlong (figuratively):--run (together, with).
to crush completely, i.e. to shatter (literally or figuratively):--break (in pieces), broken to shivers (+ -hearted), bruise.
concussion or utter fracture (properly, concretely), i.e. complete ruin:--destruction.
a fellow-nursling, i.e. comrade:--brought up with.
to chance together, i.e. meet with (reach):--come at.
an accident; Syntyche, a Christian female:--Syntyche.
to act hypocritically in concert with:--dissemble with.

entryFree.etym: from 4862 and a derivative of a compound of 5259 and the base of 2041;
entryFree.def: to be a co-auxiliary, i.e. assist:--help together.
to have (parturition) pangs in company (concert, simultaneously) with, i.e. (figuratively) to sympathize (in expectation of relief from suffering):--travail in pain together.
a swearing together, i.e. (by implication) a plot:--comspiracy.
Syracuse, the capital of Sicily:--Syracuse.
Syria (i.e. Tsyria or Tyre), a region of Asia:--Syria.
a Syran (i.e. probably Tyrian), a native of Syria:--Syrian.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a compound of 4948 and the same as 5403;
entryFree.def: a Syro-phœnician woman, i.e. a female native of Phœnicia in Syria:--Syrophenician.
a shoal (from the sand drawn thither by the waves), i.e. the Syrtis Major or great bay on the north coast of Africa:--quicksands.
to trail:--drag, draw, hale.
to rend completely, i.e. (by analogy) to convulse violently:--throw down.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 4862 and the base of 4591;
entryFree.def: a sign in common, i.e. preconcerted signal:--token.
of a joint body, i.e. (figuratively) a fellow-member of the Christian community:--of the same body.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 4862 and a derivative of 4714;
entryFree.def: a fellow-insurgent:--make insurrection with.
introductory, i.e. recommendatory:--of commendation.
to impale in company with (literally or figuratively):--crucify with.
to send (draw) together, i.e. enwrap (enshroud a corpse for burial), contract (an interval):-- short, wind up.
to moan jointly, i.e. (figuratively) experience a common calamity:--groan together.
to file together (as soldiers in ranks), i.e. (figuratively) to correspond to:--answer to.
a co-campaigner, i.e. (figuratively) an associate in Christian toil:--fellowsoldier.
to twist together, i.e. collect (a bundle, a crowd):--gather.
a twisting together, i.e. (figuratively) a secret coalition, riotous crowd:--+ band together, concourse.
to fashion alike, i.e. conform to the same pattern (figuratively):--conform to, fashion self according to.
Sychar (i.e. Shekar), a place in Palestine:--Sychar.
Sychem (i.e. Shekem), the name of a Canaanite and of a place in Palestine:--Sychem.
butchery (of animals for food or sacrifice, or (figuratively) of men (destruction)):--slaughter.
a victim (in sacrifice):--slain beast.
to butcher (especially an animal for food or in sacrifice) or (generally) to slaughter, or (specially), to maim (violently):--kill, slay, wound.
very much:--exceedingly.
to stamp (with a signet or private mark) for security or preservation (literally or figuratively); by implication, to keep secret, to attest:--(set a, set to) seal up, stop.
a signet (as fencing in or protecting from misappropriation); by implication, the stamp impressed (as a mark of privacy, or genuineness), literally or figuratively:--seal.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed derivative of the alternate of 2192 as adverb;
entryFree.def: nigh, i.e. nearly:--almost.
a figure (as a mode or circumstance), i.e. (by implication) external condition:--fashion.
to split or sever (literally or figuratively):--break, divide, open, rend, make a rent.
a split or gap ("schism"), literally or figuratively:--division, rent, schism.
to take a holiday, i.e. be at leisure for (by implication, devote oneself wholly to); figuratively, to be vacant (of a house):--empty, give self.

entryFree.etym: probably feminine of a presumed derivative of the alternate of 2192;
entryFree.def: properly, loitering (as a withholding of oneself from work) or leisure, i.e. (by implication) a "school" (as vacation from physical employment):--school.
the body (as a sound whole), used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively:--bodily, body, slave.
corporeal or physical:--bodily.
corporeally or physically:--bodily.

body.entryFree: Σώπατρος Sṓpatros, so'-pat-ros from the base of 4982 and 3962; of a safe father; Sopatrus, a Christian:--Sopater. Compare 4989.

entryFree.def: to pile up (literally or figuratively):--heap, load.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4982 and that of 4599;
entryFree.def: of safe strength; Sosthenes, a Christian:--Sosthenes.
Sosipatrus, a Christian:--Sosipater.
a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ:--saviour.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a derivative of 4990 as (properly, abstract) noun;
entryFree.def: rescue or safety (physically or morally):--deliver, health, salvation, save, saving.

entryFree.etym: neuter of the same as 4991 as (properly, concretely) noun;
entryFree.def: defender or (by implication) defence:--salvation.
to be of sound mind, i.e. sane, (figuratively) moderate:--be in right mind, be sober (minded), soberly.
to make of sound mind, i.e. (figuratively) to discipline or correct:--teach to be sober.
discipline, i.e. self-control:--sound mind.
with sound mind, i.e. moderately:--soberly.
soundness of mind, i.e. (literally) sanity or (figuratively) self-control:--soberness, sobriety.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 4982 and that of 5424;
entryFree.def: safe (sound) in mind, i.e. self-controlled (moderate as to opinion or passion):--discreet, sober, temperate.
huts or wooden-walled buildings; Tabernæ:--taverns.
the gazelle; Tabitha (i.e. Tabjetha), a Christian female:--Tabitha.
something orderly in arrangement (a troop), i.e. (figuratively) a series or succession:--order.
arranged, i.e. appointed or stated:--set.
to be wretched, i.e. realize one's own misery:--be afflicted.
wretchedness, i.e. calamity:--misery.

entryFree.etym: from the base of 5007 and a derivative of the base of 3984;
entryFree.def: enduring trial, i.e. miserable:--wretched.
talent-like in weight:--weight of a talent.
the fresh, i.e. young girl; talitha (O maiden):--talitha.
regular arrangement, i.e. (in time) fixed succession (of rank or character), official dignity:--order.
depressed, i.e. (figuratively) humiliated (in circumstances or disposition):--base, cast down, humble, of low degree (estate), lowly.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 5011 and the base of 5424;
entryFree.def: humiliation of mind, i.e. modesty:--humbleness of mind, humility (of mind, loneliness (of mind).

entryFree.etym: a prolonged form of a primary verb (which latter appears only in certain tenses);
entryFree.def: to arrange in an orderly manner, i.e. assign or dispose (to a certain position or lot):--addict, appoint, determine, ordain, set.
a bullock:--bull, ox.

entryFree.etym: nominative or accusative case neuter plural of 3778;
entryFree.def: these things:--+ afterward, follow, + hereafter, X him, the same, so, such, that, then, these, they, this, those, thus.

shortly, i.e. (figuratively) possibly:--peradventure(-haps).
briefly, i.e. (in time) speedily, or (in manner) rapidly:--hastily, quickly, shortly, soon, suddenly.
curt, i.e. impending:--shortly, swift.

entryFree.etym: neuter singular of the comparative of 5036 (as adverb);

shortly, i.e. without delay, soon, or (by surprise) suddenly, or (by implication, of ease) readily:--lightly, quickly.

body.entryFree: τέ té, teh a primary particle (enclitic) of connection or addition; both or also (properly, as correlation of 2532):--also, and, both, even, then, whether. Often used in composition, usually as the latter particle.

an infant, i.e. (plural figuratively) darlings (Christian converts):--little children.
