childbirth (parentage), i.e. (by implication) maternity (the performance of maternal duties):--childbearing.
a child (as produced):--child, daughter, son.
to be a childrearer, i.e. fulfil the duties of a female parent:--bring up children.
an artificer (as producer of fabrics), i.e. (specially), a craftsman in wood:--carpenter.
complete (in various applications of labor, growth, mental and moral character, etc.); neuter (as noun, with 3588) completeness:--of full age, man, perfect.
(the state) completeness (mentally or morally):--perfection(-ness).
to complete, i.e. (literally) accomplish, or (figuratively) consummate (in character):--consecrate, finish, fulfil, make) perfect.
completely, i.e. (of hope) without wavering:--to the end.
(the act) completion, i.e. (of prophecy) verification, or (of expiation) absolution:--perfection, performance.
a completer, i.e. consummater:--finisher.
to be a bearer to completion (maturity), i.e. to ripen fruit (figuratively):--bring fruit to perfection.
to finish life (by implication, of 979), i.e. expire (demise):--be dead, decease, die.
decease:--death.
to end, i.e. complete, execute, conclude, discharge (a debt):--accomplish, make an end, expire, fill up, finish, go over, pay, perform.

body.entryFree: TE/LOS τέλος télos tel'-os from a primary τέλλω téllō, (to set out for a definite point or goal); properly, the point aimed at as a limit, i.e. (by implication) the conclusion of an act or state (termination (literally, figuratively or indefinitely), result (immediate, ultimate or prophetic), purpose); specially, an impost or levy (as paid):--+ continual, custom, end(-ing), finally, uttermost. forty:--forty.
of forty years of age:--(+ full, of) forty years (old).
fourteenth:--fourteenth.
pertaining to the fourth day:--four days.
fourth:--four(-th).
four-cornered, i.e. square:--foursquare.

entryFree.etym: from the multiplicative adverb of 5064 and 5507;

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 5064 and 3376;

entryFree.etym: from 5064 and a derivative of the base of 4118;

the ruler of a fourth part of a country ("tetrarch"):--tetrarch.

to liquefy:--melt.

entryFree.def: in a far-shining manner, i.e. plainly:--clearly.

probably pertaining to the river Tiberis or Tiber; Tiberius, a Roman emperor:--Tiberius.

entryFree.etym: perhaps akin to the alternate of 138, and thus to 4951;
entryFree.def: to pull off:--pluck.
Timæus (i.e. Timay), an Israelite:--Timæus.
to prize, i.e. fix a valuation upon; by implication, to revere:--honour, value.
a value, i.e. money paid, or (concretely and collectively) valuables; by analogy, esteem (especially of the highest degree), or the dignity itself:--honour, precious, price, some.

dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian:--Timotheus, Timothy.
valuable; Timon, a Christian:--Timon.
vindication, i.e. (by implication) a penalty:--punishment.

some or any person or object:--a (kind of), any (man, thing, thing at all), certain (thing), divers, he (every) man, one (X thing), ought, + partly, some (man, -body, - thing, -what), (+ that no-)thing, what(-soever), X wherewith, whom(-soever), whose(-soever).

an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what (in direct or indirect questions):--every man, how (much), + no(-ne, thing), what (manner, thing), where (-by, -fore, -of, -unto, - with, -withal), whether, which, who(-m, -se), why.

entryFree.etym: of Latin origin but uncertain significance;
entryFree.def: Titus, a Christian:--Titus.

sometimes used for 5127; of this person:--his.

entryFree.etym: contraction for the neuter of 3588 and 1726;

to creak (squeak), i.e. (by analogy) to grate the teeth (in frenzy):--gnash.

three times:--three times, thrice.

hairy, i.e. made of hair (mohair):--of hair.

nourishment (literally or figuratively); by implication, rations (wages):--food, meat.

body.entryFree: TRUMALIA/ τρυμαλιά trymaliá troo-mal-ee-ah' from a derivative of τρύω trýō, (to wear away; akin to the base of 5134, 5147 and 5176); an orifice, i.e. needle's eye:--eye. Compare 5169.

body.entryFree: TUGXA/NW τυγχάνω tynchánō toong-khan'-o probably for an obsolete TU/XW τύχω týchō (for which the middle voice of another alternate τεύχω teúchō, (to make ready or bring to pass) is used in certain tenses; akin to the base of 5088 through the idea of effecting; properly, to affect; or (specially), to hit or light upon (as a mark to be reached), i.e. (transitively) to attain or secure an object or end, or (intransitively) to happen (as if meeting with); but in the latter application only impersonal (with 1487), i.e. perchance; or (present participle) as adjective, usual (as if commonly met with, with 3756, extraordinary), neuter (as adverb) perhaps; or (with another verb) as adverb, by accident (as it were):--be, chance, enjoy, little, obtain, X refresh…self, + special. Compare 5180.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of 5180 (meaning a drum, "tympanum");
entryFree.def: to stretch on an instrument of torture resembling a drum, and thus beat to death:--torture.

a die (as struck), i.e. (by implication) a stamp or scar; by analogy, a shape, i.e. a statue, (figuratively) style or resemblance; specially, a sampler ("type"), i.e. a model (for imitation) or instance (for warning):--en-(ex-)ample, fashion, figure, form, manner, pattern, print.

entryFree.etym: a primary verb (in a strengthened form);
entryFree.def: to "thump", i.e. cudgel or pummel (properly, with a stick or bastinado), but in any case by repeated blows; thus differing from 3817 and 3960, which denote a (usually single) blow with the hand or any instrument, or 4141 with the fist (or a hammer), or 4474 with the palm; as well as from 5177, an accidental collision); by implication, to punish; figuratively, to offend (the conscience):--beat, smite, strike, wound.

stormy (as if smoky):--tempestuous.
fortuitous, i.e. fortunate; Tychicus, a Christian:--Tychicus.

insolence (as over-bearing), i.e. insult, injury:--harm, hurt, reproach.
an insulter, i.e. maltreater:--despiteful, injurious.
to have sound health, i.e. be well (in body); figuratively, to be uncorrupt (true in doctrine):--be in health, (be safe and) sound, (be) whole(-some).
healthy, i.e. well (in body); figuratively, true (in doctrine):--sound, whole.
wet (as if with rain), i.e. (by implication) sappy (fresh):--green.
a water-jar, i.e. receptacle for family supply:--water-pot.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 5204 and a derivative of 4095;

a forest, i.e. (by implication) fuel:--matter.

you (as subjective of verb):--ye (yourselves), you.
yours, i.e. pertaining to you:--your (own).
to (with or by) you:--ye, you, your(-selves).
to hymn, i.e. sing a religious ode; by implication, to celebrate (God) in song:--sing a hymn (praise unto).
of (from or concerning) you:--ye, you, your (own, -selves).
to lead (oneself) under, i.e. withdraw or retire (as if sinking out of sight), literally or figuratively:--depart, get hence, go (a-)way.
attentive hearkening, i.e. (by implication) compliance or submission:--obedience, (make) obedient, obey(-ing).
to hear under (as a subordinate), i.e. to listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority:--hearken, be obedient to, obey.
in subjection under a man, i.e. a married woman:--which hath an husband.
to go opposite (meet) under (quietly), i.e. to encounter, fall in with:--(go to) meet.
an encounter or concurrence (with 1519 for infinitive, in order to fall in with):--meeting.
existency or proprietorship, i.e. (concretely) property, wealth:--goods, substance.

entryFree.etym: neuter plural of present participle active of 5225 as noun;
entryFree.def: things extant or in hand, i.e. property or possessions:--goods, that which one has, things which (one) possesseth, substance, that hast.

to begin under (quietly), i.e. come into existence (be present or at hand); expletively, to exist (as copula or subordinate to an adjective, participle, adverb or preposition, or as an auxiliary to a principal (verb):--after, behave, live.
under (covertly) contrary to, i.e. opposed or (as noun) an opponent:--adversary, against.

body.entryFree: ὑπέρ hypér, hoop-er' a primary preposition; "over", i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than:--(+ exceeding, abundantly) above, in (on) behalf of, beyond, by, + very chiefest, concerning, exceeding (above, -ly), for, + very highly, more (than), of, over, on the part of, for sake of, in stead, than, to(-ward), very. In the compounds, it retains many of the above applications.

entryFree.def: to raise oneself over, i.e. (figuratively) to become haughty:--exalt self, be exalted above measure.
beyond the "acme", i.e. figuratively (of a daughter) past the bloom (prime) of youth:--+ pass the flower of (her) age.
above upward, i.e. greatly higher (in place or rank):--far above, over.
to increase above ordinary degree:--grow exceedingly.
to transcend, i.e. (figuratively) to overreach:--go beyond.

entryFree.etym: adverb from present participle active of 5235;
entryFree.def: excessively:--beyond measure.
to throw beyod the usual mark, i.e. (figuratively) to surpass (only active participle supereminent):--exceeding, excel, pass.
a throwing beyond others, i.e. (figuratively) supereminence; adverbially (with 1519 or 2596) pre- eminently:--abundance, (far more) exceeding, excellency, more excellent, beyond (out of) measure.
to overlook, i.e. not punish:--wink at.

entryFree.etym: from 5228 and the neuter plural of 1565;
entryFree.def: above those parts, i.e. still farther:--beyond.
to extend inordinately:--stretch beyond.

entryFree.etym: from 5228 and the alternate form of 1632;
entryFree.def: to pour out over, i.e. (passively) to overflow:--run over.
to intercede in behalf of:--make intercession for.
to hold oneself above, i.e. (figuratively) to excel; participle (as adjective, or neuter as noun) superior, superiority:--better, excellency, higher, pass, supreme.
haughtiness:--pride.
appearing above others (conspicuous), i.e. (figuratively) haughty:--proud.
to vanquish beyond, i.e. gain a decisive victory:--more than conquer.
bulging over, i.e. (figuratively) insolent:--great swelling.
prominence, i.e. (figuratively) superiority (in rank or character):--authority, excellency.
to super-abound:--abound much more, exceeding.
superabundantly, i.e. exceedingly:--beyond measure.
to superabound:--be exceeding abundant.
to elevate above others, i.e. raise to the highest position:--highly exalt.
to esteem oneself overmuch, i.e. be vain or arrogant:--think more highly.
a higher part of the house, i.e. apartment in the third story:--upper chamber (room).
to hold oneself under, i.e. endure with patience:--suffer.
attentively listening, i.e. (by implication) submissive:--obedient.
to be a subordinate, i.e. (by implication) subserve:--minister (unto), serve.

entryFree.etym: from an obsolete primary (perhaps akin to 5259 through the idea of subsilience);
entryFree.def: sleep, i.e. (figuratively) spiritual torpor:--sleep.

body.entryFree: ὑπό hypó, hoop-o' a primary preposition; under, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place (beneath), or with verbs (the agency or means, through); (with the accusative case) of place (whither (underneath) or where (below) or time (when (at)):--among, by, from, in, of, under, with. In the compounds, it retains the same general applications, especially of inferior position or condition, and specially, covertly or moderately.

entryFree.def: to throw in stealthily, i.e. introduce by collusion:--suborn.
an underwriting, i.e. copy for imitation (figuratively):--example.
an exhibit for imitation or warning (figuratively, specimen, adumbration):--en-(ex-)ample, pattern.
to exhibit under the eyes, i.e. (figuratively) to exemplify (instruct, admonish):--show, (fore-)warn.
to admit under one's roof, i.e. entertain hospitably:--receive.
to bind under one's feet, i.e. put on shoes or sandals:--bind on, (be) shod.
something bound under the feet, i.e. a shoe or sandal:--shoe.
under sentence, i.e. (by implication) condemned:--guilty.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 5259 and 2218;
entryFree.def: an animal under the yoke (draught-beast), i.e. (specially), a donkey:--ass.
to gird under, i.e. frap (a vessel with cables across the keel, sides and deck):--undergirt.
down under, i.e. beneath:--under.
to decide (speak or act) under a false part, i.e. (figuratively) dissemble (pretend):--feign.
acting under a feigned part, i.e. (figuratively) deceit ("hypocrisy"):--condemnation, dissimulation, hypocrisy.
an actor under an assumed character (stage-player), i.e. (figuratively) a dissembler ("hypocrite":--hypocrite.
to take from below, i.e. carry upward; figuratively, to take up, i.e. continue a discourse or topic; mentally, to assume (presume):--answer, receive, suppose.
to leave under (behind), i.e. (passively) to remain (survive):--be left.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a presumed compound of 5259 and 3025;
entryFree.def: vessel or receptacle under the press, i.e. lower wine-vat:--winefat.
to leave behind, i.e. bequeath:--leave.
to stay under (behind), i.e. remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. bear (trials), have fortitude, persevere:--abide, endure, (take) patient(-ly), suffer, tarry behind.
to remind quietly, i.e. suggest to the (middle voice, one's own) memory:--put in mind, remember, bring to (put in) remembrance.
a reminding or (reflexively) recollection:--remembrance.
cheerful (or hopeful) endurance, constancy:--enduring, patience, patient continuance (waiting).
to think under (privately), i.e. to surmise or conjecture:--think, suppose, deem.
suspicion:--surmising.
to sail under the lee of:--sail under.
to breathe gently, i.e. breeze:--blow softly.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 5259 and 4228;

a setting under (support), i.e. (figuratively) concretely, essence, or abstractly, assurance (objectively or subjectively):--confidence, confident, person, substance.
to withhold under (out of sight), i.e. (reflexively) to cower or shrink, (figuratively) to conceal (reserve):--draw (keep) back, shun, withdraw.
shrinkage (timidity), i.e. (by implication) apostasy:--draw back.
to turn under (behind), i.e. to return (literally or figuratively):--come again, return (again, back again), turn back (again).
to strew underneath (the feet as a carpet):--spread.
subordination:--subjection.
to subordinate; reflexively, to obey:--be under obedience (obedient), put under, subdue unto, (be, make) subject (to, unto), be (put) in subjection (to, under), submit self unto.
to place underneath, i.e. (figuratively) to hazard, (reflexively) to suggest:--lay down, put in remembrance.
to run under, i.e. (specially), to sail past:--run under.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 5259 and a derivative of 5179;
entryFree.def: typification under (after), i.e. (concretely) a sketch (figuratively) for imitation:--form, pattern.
to bear from underneath, i.e. (figuratively) to undergo hardship:--bear, endure.
to vacate down, i.e. retire quietly:--go aside, withdraw self.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 5259 and a derivative of 3700;
entryFree.def: to hit under the eye (buffet or disable an antagonist as a pugilist), i.e. (figuratively) to tease or annoy (into compliance), subdue (one's passions):--keep under, weary.
a hog ("swine"):--sow.
"hyssop":--hyssop.
to be later, i.e. (by implication) to be inferior; generally, to fall short (be deficient):--come behind (short), be destitute, fail, lack, suffer need, (be in) want, be the worse.
a deficit; specially, poverty:--that which is behind, (that which was) lack(-ing), penury, want.
a falling short, i.e. (specially), penury:--want.
more lately, i.e. eventually:--afterward, (at the) last (of all).

entryFree.etym: comparative from 5259 (in the sense of behind);
entryFree.def: later:--latter.
lofty (in place or character):--high(-er, -ly) (esteemed).
to be lofty in mind, i.e. arrogant:--be highminded.
highest, i.e. (masculine singular) the Supreme (God), or (neuter plural) the heavens:--most high, highest.
elevation, i.e. (abstractly) altitude, (specially), the sky, or (figuratively) dignity:--be exalted, height, (on) high.
to elevate (literally or figuratively):--exalt, lift up.
an elevated place or thing, i.e. (abstractly) altitude, or (by implication) a barrier (figuratively):-- height, high thing.
a glutton:--gluttonous.

entryFree.etym: a primary verb (used as an alternate of 2068 in certain tenses);
entryFree.def: to eat (literally or figuratively):--eat, meat.
to lighten (shine), i.e. show (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative):-- appear, seem, be seen, shine, X think.
Phalek (i.e. Peleg), a patriarch:--Phalec.
shining, i.e. apparent (literally or figuratively); neuter (as adverb) publicly, externally:--abroad, + appear, known, manifest, open (+ -ly), outward (+ -ly).
to render apparent (literally or figuratively):--appear, manifestly declare, (make) manifest (forth), shew (self).
plainly, i.e. clearly or publicly:--evidently, openly.
exhibition, i.e. (figuratively) expression, (by extension) a bestowment:--manifestation.
a lightener, i.e. light; lantern:--lantern.
Phanuel (i.e. Penuel), an Israelite:--Phanuel.
to make apparent, i.e. (passively) to appear (neuter participle as noun, a spectacle):--sight.
(properly abstract) a (vain) show ("fantasy"):--pomp.
(properly concrete) a (mere) show ("phantasm"), i.e. spectre:--spirit.

entryFree.etym: properly, strengthened from the base of 4008 or rather of 4486;
entryFree.def: a gap or chasm, i.e. ravine (winter-torrent):--valley.
Pharao (i.e. Pharoh), an Egyptian king:--Pharaoh.
Phares (i.e. Perets), an Israelite:--Phares.
a separatist, i.e. exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary:--Pharisee.
medication ("pharmacy"), i.e. (by extension) magic (literally or figuratively):--sorcery, witchcraft.

entryFree.etym: from 5346 (not the same as "phase", which is from 5316);
entryFree.def: a saying, i.e. report:--tidings.
to assert:--affirm, profess, say.
"foul" or "flawy", i.e. (figuratively) wicked:--evil.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to the base of 5457 (compare 5350);
entryFree.def: brilliancy:--light.
to be chary of, i.e. (subjectively) to abstain or (objectively) to treat leniently:--forbear, spare.
abstemiously, i.e. stingily:--sparingly.

entryFree.etym: by transposition for a derivative probably of 5316 (as showing outside the other garments);
entryFree.def: a mantle (surtout):-- cloke.
to run away (literally or figuratively); by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish:--escape, flee (away).
happy; Phelix (i.e. Felix), a Roman:--Felix.
a saying, i.e. rumor ("fame"):--fame.

body.entryFree: φημί phēmí, fay-mee' properly, the same as the base of 5457 and 5316; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. speak or say:--affirm, say. Compare 3004.

entryFree.def: festal; Phestus (i.e. Festus), a Roman:--Festus.
to be beforehand, i.e. anticipate or precede; by extension, to have arrived at:--(already) attain, come, prevent.
decayed, i.e. (by implication) perishable:--corruptible.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to 5338 and thus to 5346;
entryFree.def: to utter a clear sound, i.e. (generally) to proclaim:--speak.
utterance, i.e. a musical note (vocal or instrumental):--sound.
to be jealous of:--envy.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to the base of 5351;
entryFree.def: ill-will (as detraction), i.e. jealousy (spite):--envy.
decay, i.e. ruin (spontaneous or inflicted, literally or figuratively):--corruption, destroy, perish.
a broad shallow cup ("phial"):--vial.
fond to good, i.e. a promoter of virtue:--love of good men.
fraternal affection:--brotherly love (kindness), love of the brethren.
fond of brethren, i.e. fraternal:--love as brethren.
fond of man, i.e. affectionate as a wife:--love their husbands.
fondness of mankind, i.e. benevolence ("philanthropy"):--kindness, love towards man.

entryFree.etym: adverb from a compound of 5384 and 444;
entryFree.def: fondly to man ("philanthropically"), i.e. humanely:--courteously.
avarice:--love of money.
fond of silver (money), i.e. avaricious:--covetous.
fond of self, i.e. selfish:--lover of own self.

to be a friend to (fond of (an individual or an object)), i.e. have affection for (denoting personal attachment, as a matter of sentiment or feeling; while 25 is wider, embracing especially the judgment and the deliberate assent of the will as a matter of principle, duty and propriety: the two thus stand related very much as 2309 and 1014, or as 2372 and 3563 respectively; the former being chiefly of the heart and the latter of the head); specially, to kiss (as a mark of tenderness):--kiss, love.
fond of pleasure, i.e. voluptuous:--lover of pleasure.
a kiss:--kiss.
friendly; Philemon, a Christian:--Philemon.
amiable; Philetus, an opposer of Christianity:--Philetus.
fondness:--friendship.
a Philippesian (Philippian), i.e. native of Philippi:--Philippian.
Philippi, a place in Macedonia:--Philippi.
fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites:--Philip.
fond of God, i.e. pious:--lover of God.
fond of words, i.e. talkative (argumentative, learned, "philological"); Philologus, a Christian:--Philologus.
quarrelsomeness, i.e. a dispute:--strife.
hospitableness:--entertain stranger, hospitality.
fond of guests, i.e. hospitable:--given to (lover of, use) hospitality.
to be fond of being first, i.e. ambitious of distinction:--love to have the preeminence.
actively, fond, i.e. friendly (still as a noun, an associate, neighbor, etc.):--friend.
"philosophy", i.e. (specially), Jewish sophistry:--philosophy.
fond of wise things, i.e. a "philosopher":--philosopher.
fond of one's children, i.e. maternal:--love their children.

entryFree.etym: middle voice from a compound of 5384 and 5092;
entryFree.def: to be fond of honor, i.e. emulous (eager or earnest to do something):--labour, strive, study.
with friendliness of mind, i.e. kindly:--courteously.
friendly of mind, i.e. kind:--courteous.

entryFree.etym: active participle of the base of 5395;
entryFree.def: blazing; Phlegon, a Christian:--Phlegon.
to cause a blaze, i.e. ignite (figuratively, to inflame with passion):--set on fire.
to be a babbler or trifler, i.e. (by implication) to berate idly or mischievously:--prate against.
frightful, i.e. (objectively) formidable:--fearful, terrible.
to frighten, i.e. (passively) to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. revere:--be (+ sore) afraid, fear (exceedingly), reverence.
a frightening thing, i.e. terrific portent:--fearful sight.
palm-country; Phœnice (or Phœnicia), a region of Palestine:--Phenice, Phenicia.
a palm-tree:--palm (tree).
Phœnix, a place in Crete:--Phenice.
a murderer (always of criminal (or at least intentional) homicide; which 443 does not necessarily imply; while 4607 is a special term for a public bandit):--murderer.
to be a murderer (of):--kill, do murder, slay.
to have a burden, i.e. (by analogy) to wear as clothing or a constant accompaniment:--bear, wear.
a forum or market-place; only in compound with 675; a station on the Appian road:--forum.
a load (as borne), i.e. (figuratively) a tax (properly, an individual assessment on persons or property; whereas 5056 is usually a general toll on goods or travel):--tribute.
to load up (properly, as a vessel or animal), i.e. (figuratively) to overburden with ceremony (or spiritual anxiety):--lade, by heavy laden.
an invoice (as part of freight), i.e. (figuratively) a task or service:--burden.
something carried, i.e. the cargo of a ship:--lading.
"fortunate"; Fortunatus, a Christian:--Fortunatus.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a derivative from the base of 5417;
entryFree.def: a whip, i.e. Roman lash as a public punishment:--scourge.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed equivalent of the Latin flagellum;
entryFree.def: to whip, i.e. lash as a public punishment:--scourge.
a fence, or inclosing barrier (literally or figuratively):--hedge (+ round about), partition.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to 5420 through the idea of defining;
entryFree.def: to indicate (by word or act), i.e. (specially), to expound:-- declare.

entryFree.etym: apparently a strengthening form of the base of 5424;
entryFree.def: to fence or inclose, i.e. (specially), to block up (figuratively, to silence):--stop.
a hole in the ground (dug for obtaining or holding water or other purposes), i.e. a cistern or well; figuratively, an abyss (as a prison):--well, pit.
to be a mind-misleader, i.e. delude:--deceive.
a mind-misleader, i.e. seducer:--deceiver.
to "bristle" or chill, i.e. shudder (fear):--tremble.

to exercise the mind, i.e. entertain or have a sentiment or opinion; by implication, to be (mentally) disposed (more or less earnestly in a certain direction); intensively, to interest oneself in (with concern or obedience):--set the affection on, (be) care(-ful), (be like-, + be of one, + be of the same, + let this) mind(-ed), regard, savour, think.
(mental) inclination or purpose:--(be, + be carnally, + be spiritually) mind(-ed).
mental action or activity, i.e. intellectual or moral insight:--prudence, wisdom.

thoughtful, i.e. sagacious or discreet (implying a cautious character; while 4680 denotes practical skill or acumen; and 4908 indicates rather intelligence or mental acquirement); in a bad sense conceited (also in the comparative):--wise(-r).
prudently:--wisely.
to exercise thought, i.e. be anxious:--be careful.

body.entryFree: φρουρέω phrouréō, froo-reh'-o from a compound of 4253 and 3708; to be a watcher in advance, i.e. to mount guard as a sentinel (post spies at gates); figuratively, to hem in, protect:--keep (with a garrison). Compare 5083.

entryFree.def: to snort (as a spirited horse), i.e. (figuratively) to make a tumult:--rage.
Phrygia, a region of Asia Minor:--Phrygia.
fugitive; Phygellus, an apostate Christian:--Phygellus.
a fleeing, i.e. escape:--flight.

a guarding or (concretely, guard), the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or (specially), the time (as a division of day or night), literally or figuratively:--cage, hold, (im-)prison(-ment), ward, watch.
to incarcerate:--imprison.
a guard-case, i.e. "phylactery" for wearing slips of Scripture texts:-- phylactery.
a watcher or sentry:--keeper.

body.entryFree: φυλάσσω phylássō, foo-las'-so probably from 5443 through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. be on guard (literally of figuratively); by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid:--beward, keep (self), observe, save. Compare 5083.

entryFree.def: an offshoot, i.e. race or clan:--kindred, tribe.
a sprout, i.e. leaf:--leaf.

body.entryFree: φυσικός physikós, foo-see-kos' from 5449; "physical", i.e. (by implication) instinctive:--natural. Compare 5591.

entryFree.def: "physically", i.e. (by implication) instinctively:--naturally.

entryFree.etym: from 5449 in the primary sense of blowing;
entryFree.def: to inflate, i.e. (figuratively) make proud (haughty):--puff up.

growth (by germination or expansion), i.e. (by implication) natural production (lineal descent); by extension, a genus or sort; figuratively, native disposition, constitution or usage:--(man-)kind, nature(-al).
inflation, i.e. (figuratively) haughtiness:--swelling.
trans-planting, i.e. (concretely) a shrub or vegetable:--plant.
to set out in the earth, i.e. implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine:--plant.
probably originally, to "puff" or blow, i.e. to swell up; but only used in the implied sense, to germinate or grow (sprout, produce), literally or figuratively:--spring (up).
a burrow or lurking-place:--hole.
to emit a sound (animal, human or instrumental); by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation:--call (for), crow, cry.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to 5316 through the idea of disclosure;
entryFree.def: a tone (articulate, bestial or artificial); by implication, an address (for any purpose), saying or language:--noise, sound, voice.
an illuminator, i.e. (concretely) a luminary, or (abstractly) brilliancy:--light.
light-bearing ("phosphorus"), i.e. (specially), the morning-star (figuratively):--day star.
lustrous, i.e. transparent or well-illuminated (figuratively):--bright, full of light.
to shed rays, i.e. to shine or (transitively) to brighten up (literally or figuratively):--enlighten, illuminate, (bring to, give) light, make to see.
illumination (figuratively):--light.
to be "cheer"ful, i.e. calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation (on meeting or parting), be well:--farewell, be glad, God speed, greeting, hall, joy(- fully), rejoice.
hail:--hail.
to lower (as into a void):--let down, strike.
a Chaldæan (i.e. Kasdi), or native or the region of the lower Euphrates:--Chaldæan.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from 5465 through the idea of reducing the strength;
entryFree.def: difficult, i.e. dangerous, or (by implication) furious:--fierce, perilous.

entryFree.etym: from a compound of 5469 and the reduplicated form of 71;
entryFree.def: to be a bit-leader, i.e. to curb (figuratively):--bridle.
a curb or head-stall (as curbing the spirit):--bit, bridle.
coppery:--brass.
a copper-worker or brazier:--coppersmith.
copper-like, i.e. "chalcedony":--chalcedony.
a copper dish:--brazen vessel.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 5475 and 3030 (in the implied mean of whiteness or brilliancy);
entryFree.def: burnished copper, an alloy of copper (or gold) and silver having a brilliant lustre:--fine brass.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from 5465 through the idea of hollowing out as a vessel (this metal being chiefly used for that purpose);
entryFree.def: copper (the substance, or some implement or coin made of it):--brass, money.

entryFree.etym: adverb perhaps from the base of 5490 through the idea of a fissure in the soil;
entryFree.def: earthward, i.e. prostrate:--on (to) the ground.
Chanaan (i.e. Kenaan), the early name of Palestine:--Chanaan.
a Chanaanæan (i.e. Kenaanite), or native of gentile Palestine:--of Canaan.
cheerfulness, i.e. calm delight:--gladness, X greatly, (X be exceeding) joy(-ful, -fully, -fulness, -ous).
a scratch or etching, i.e. stamp (as a badge of servitude), or sculptured figure (statue):--graven, mark.
a graver (the tool or the person), i.e. (by implication) engraving (("character"), the figure stamped, i.e. an exact copy or (figuratively) representation):--express image.
to grant as a favor, i.e. gratuitously, in kindness, pardon or rescue:--deliver, (frankly) forgive, (freely) give, grant.
through favor of, i.e. on account of:--be-(for) cause of, for sake of, +…fore, X reproachfully.

graciousness (as gratifying), of manner or act (abstract or concrete; literal, figurative or spiritual; especially the divine influence upon the heart, and its reflection in the life; including gratitude):--acceptable, benefit, favour, gift, grace(- ious), joy, liberality, pleasure, thank(-s, -worthy).
a (divine) gratuity, i.e. deliverance (from danger or passion); (specially), a (spiritual) endowment, i.e. (subjectively) religious qualification, or (objectively) miraculous faculty:--(free) gift.
to grace, i.e. indue with special honor:--make accepted, be highly favoured.
Charrhan (i.e. Charan), a place in Mesopotamia:--Charran.
a sheet ("chart") of writing-material (as to be scribbled over):--paper.

entryFree.etym: from a form of the same as 5490;
entryFree.def: a lip (as a pouring place); figuratively, a margin (of water):--lip, shore.
to storm, i.e. (passively) to labor under a gale:--be tossed with tempest.
a storm-runlet, i.e. winter-torrent:--brook.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from the base of 5494 in the sense of its congener the base of 5490 (through the idea of hollowness for grasping);
entryFree.def: the hand (literally or figuratively (power); especially (by Hebraism) a means or instrument):--hand.
to be a hand-leader, i.e. to guide (a blind person):--lead by the hand.

entryFree.etym: from 5495 and a reduplicated form of 71;
entryFree.def: a hand-leader, i.e. personal conductor (of a blind person):--some to lead by the hand.

entryFree.etym: neuter of a compound of 5495 and 1125;
entryFree.def: something hand-written ("chirograph"), i.e. a manuscript (specially, a legal document or bond (figuratively)):--handwriting.
manufactured, i.e. of human construction:--made by (make with) hands.
"cherubim" (i.e. cherubs or kerubim):--cherubims.

entryFree.etym: feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of 5490 through the idea of deficiency;
entryFree.def: a widow (as lacking a husband), literally or figuratively:--widow.
"yesterday"; by extension, in time past or hitherto:--yesterday.
one thousand ("chiliad"):--thousand.
the commander of a thousand soldiers ("chiliarch"; i.e. colonel:--(chief, high) captain.
a thousand:--thousand.
Chios, an island in the Mediterranean:--Chios.
a tunic or shirt:--clothes, coat, garment.

entryFree.etym: perhaps akin to the base of 5490 (5465) or 5494 (as descending or empty);
entryFree.def: snow:--snow.
a military cloak:--robe.
to throw out the lip, i.e. jeer at:--mock.

entryFree.etym: feminine of apparently a primary word;
entryFree.def: "green"; Chloë, a Christian female:--Chloe.
greenish, i.e. verdant, dun-colored:--green, pale.

entryFree.etym: the 22nd, 14th and an obsolete letter (4742 as a cross) of the Greek alphabet (intermediate between the 5th and 6th), used as numbers; denoting respectively 600, 60 and 6;
entryFree.def: 666 as a numeral:--six hundred threescore and six.
dusty or dirty (soil-like), i.e. (by implication) terrene:--earthy.
a chœnix or certain dry measure:--measure.
a hog:--swine.
to be bilious, i.e. (by implication) irritable (enraged, "choleric"):--be angry.

entryFree.etym: feminine of an equivalent perhaps akin to the same as 5514 (from the greenish hue);
entryFree.def: "gall" or bile, i.e. (by analogy) poison or an anodyne (wormwood, poppy, etc.):--gall.
a heap (as poured out), i.e. rubbish; loose dirt:--dust.
Chorazin, a place in Palestine:--Chorazin.
to be a dance-leader, i.e. (generally) to furnish:--give, minister.
a ring, i.e. round dance ("choir":--dancing.
to fodder, i.e. (generally) to gorge (supply food in abundance):--feed, fill, satisfy.
forage, i.e. food:--sustenance.
a "court" or "garden", i.e. (by implication, of pasture) herbage or vegetation:--blade, grass, hay.
Chuzas, an officer of Herod:--Chuza.

body.entryFree: χράομαι chráomai, khrah'-om-ahee middle voice of a primary verb (perhaps rather from 5495, to handle); to furnish what is needed; (give an oracle, "graze" (touch slightly), light upon, etc.), i.e. (by implication) to employ or (by extension) to act towards one in a given manner:--entreat, use. Compare 5531; 5534.

entryFree.etym: probably the same as the base of 5530;
entryFree.def: to loan:--lend.
employment, i.e. an affair; also (by implication) occasion, demand, requirement or destitution:--business, lack, necessary(-ity), need(-ful), use, want.
a loan-ower, i.e. indebted person:--debtor.

entryFree.etym: third person singular of the same as 5530 or 5531 used impersonally;
entryFree.def: it needs (must or should) be:--ought.
to make (i.e. have) necessity, i.e. be in want of:--(have) need.
something useful or needed, i.e. wealth, price:--money, riches.

to utter an oracle (compare the original sense of 5530), i.e. divinely intimate; by implication, (compare the secular sense of 5532) to constitute a firm for business, i.e. (generally) bear as a title:--be called, be admonished (warned) of God, reveal, speak.
a divine response or revelation:--answer of God.
serviceable:--profit.
employment, i.e. (specially), sexual intercourse (as an occupation of the body):--use.
to show oneself useful, i.e. act benevolently:--be kind.
fair speech, i.e. plausibility:--good words.
employed, i.e. (by implication) useful (in manner or morals):--better, easy, good(-ness), gracious, kind.
usefulness, i.e. morally, excellence (in character or demeanor):--gentleness, good(-ness), kindness.
an unguent or smearing, i.e. (figuratively) the special endowment ("chrism") of the Holy Spirit:--anointing, unction.
a Christian, i.e. follower of Christ:--Christian.
anointed, i.e. the Messiah, an epithet of Jesus:--Christ.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to 5530 through the idea of contact;
entryFree.def: to smear or rub with oil, i.e. (by implication) to consecrate to an office or religious service:--anoint.
to take time, i.e. linger:--delay, tarry.

a space of time (in general, and thus properly distinguished from 2540, which designates a fixed or special occasion; and from 165, which denotes a particular period) or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay:--+ years old, season, space, (X often-)time(-s), (a) while.

entryFree.etym: from a presumed compound of 5550 and the base of 5147;
entryFree.def: to be a time-wearer, i.e. to procrastinate (linger):--spend time.
made of gold:--of gold, golden.
a golden article, i.e. gold plating, ornament, or coin:--gold.
gold-ringed, i.e. wearing a golden finger-ring or similar jewelry:--with a gold ring.
gold-stone, i.e. a yellow gem ("chrysolite"):--chrysolite.

entryFree.etym: perhaps from the base of 5530 (through the idea of the utility of the metal);
entryFree.def: gold; by extension, a golden article, as an ornament or coin:--gold.
to gild, i.e. bespangle with golden ornaments:--deck.

entryFree.etym: probably akin to the base of 5530 through the idea of handling;
entryFree.def: the body (properly, its surface or skin):--body.
"halt", i.e. limping:--cripple, halt, lame.

body.entryFree: χώρα chṓra, kho'-rah feminine of a derivative of the base of 5490 through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. a space of territory (more or less extensive; often including its inhabitants):--coast, county, fields, ground, land, region. Compare 5117.

entryFree.def: to be in (give) space, i.e. (intransitively) to pass, enter, or (transitively) to hold, admit (literally or figuratively):--come, contain, go, have place, (can, be room to) receive.
to place room between, i.e. part; reflexively, to go away:--depart, put asunder, separate.
a spot or plot of ground:--field, land, parcel of ground, place, possession.
at a space, i.e. separately or apart from (often as preposition):--beside, by itself, without.
the north-west wind:--north west.

body.entryFree: ψαλμός psalmós, psal-mos' from 5567; a set piece of music, i.e. a sacred ode (accompanied with the voice, harp or other instrument; a "psalm"); collectively, the book of the Psalms:--psalm. Compare 5603.

entryFree.def: a spurious brother, i.e. pretended associate:--false brethren.
a spurious apostle, i.e. pretended pracher:--false teacher.
untrue, i.e. erroneous, deceitful, wicked:--false, liar.
a spurious teacher, i.e. propagator of erroneous Christian doctrine:--false teacher.
mendacious, i.e. promulgating erroneous Christian doctrine:--speaking lies.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of an apparently primary verb;
entryFree.def: to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood:--falsely, lie.

entryFree.etym: from 5571 and a kindred form of 3144;
entryFree.def: a spurious witness, i.e. bearer of untrue testimony:--false witness.
to be an untrue testifier, i.e. offer falsehood in evidence:--be a false witness.
untrue testimony:--false witness.
a spurious prophet, i.e. pretended foreteller or religious impostor:--false prophet.
a falsehood:--lie, lying.
a spurious Messiah:--false Christ.
untruly named:--falsely so called.
a fabrication, i.e. falsehood:--lie.
a falsifier:--liar.
to manipulate, i.e. verify by contact; figuratively, to search for:--feel after, handle, touch.
to use pebbles in enumeration, i.e. (generally) to compute:--count.
a pebble (as worn smooth by handling), i.e. (by implication, of use as a counter or ballot) a verdict (of acquittal) or ticket (of admission); a vote:--stone, voice.
a secret calumniator:--whisperer.

entryFree.etym: diminutive from a derivative of the base of 5567 (meaning a crumb);
entryFree.def: a little bit or morsel:--crumb.

breath, i.e. (by implication) spirit, abstractly or concretely [the animal sentient principle only; thus distinguished on the one hand from 4151, which is the rational and immortal soul; and on the other from 2222, which is mere vitality, even of plants: these terms thus exactly correspond respectively to the Hebrew 05315, 07307 and 02416]:--heart (+ -ily), life, mind, soul, + us, + you.
sensitive, i.e. animate (in distinction on the one hand from 4152, which is the higher or renovated nature; and on the other from 5446, which is the lower or bestial nature):--natural, sensual.
coolness:--cold.
chilly (literally or figuratively):--cold.

to breathe (voluntarily but gently, thus differing on the one hand from 4154, which denotes properly a forcible respiration; and on the other from the base of 109, which refers properly to an inanimate breeze), i.e. (by implication, of reduction of temperature by evaporation) to chill (figuratively):--wax cold.
to supply with bits, i.e. (generally) to nourish:--(bestow to) feed.

entryFree.etym: diminutive from a derivative of the base of 5597;
entryFree.def: a crumb or morsel (as if rubbed off), i.e. a mouthful:--sop.

entryFree.etym: prolongation from the same base as 5567;
entryFree.def: to triturate, i.e. (by analogy) to rub out (kernels from husks with the fingers or hand):--rub.
the last letter of the Greek alphabet, i.e. (figuratively) the finality:--Omega.
as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh:--O.
Obed, an Israelite:--Obed.
in this same spot, i.e. here or hither:--here, hither, (in) this place, there.
a chant or "ode" (the general term for any words sung; while 5215 denotes especially a religious metrical composition, and 5568 still more specially, a Hebrew cantillation):--song.
a pang or throe, especially of childbirth:--pain, sorrow, travail.
to experience the pains of parturition (literally or figuratively):--travail in (birth).
the shoulder (as that on which burdens are borne):--shoulder.
an "egg":--egg.
an "hour" (literally or figuratively):--day, hour, instant, season, X short, (even-)tide, (high) time.
belonging to the right hour or season (timely), i.e. (by implication) flourishing (beauteous (figuratively)):--beautiful.

entryFree.etym: middle voice of an apparently primary verb;
entryFree.def: to "roar":--roar.

which how, i.e. in that manner (very variously used, as follows):--about, after (that), (according) as (it had been, it were), as soon (as), even as (like), for, how (greatly), like (as, unto), since, so (that), that, to wit, unto, when(-soever), while, X with all speed.
oh save!; hosanna (i.e. hoshia-na), an exclamation of adoration:--hosanna.
as thus, i.e. in the same way:--even so, likewise, after the same (in like) manner.
as if:--about, as (it had been, it were), like (as).
Hosee (i.e. Hoshea), an Israelite:--Osee.
just as, i.e. exactly like:--(even, like) as.
just as if, i.e. as it were:--as.
so too, i.e. thus therefore (in various relations of consecution, as follow):--(insomuch) as, so that (then), (insomuch) that, therefore, to, wherefore.
an earlet, i.e. one of the ears, or perhaps the lobe of the ear:--ear.

entryFree.etym: from a derivative of the base of 5624;
entryFree.def: usefulness, i.e. benefit:--advantage, profit.
to be useful, i.e. to benefit:--advantage, better, prevail, profit.
helpful or serviceable, i.e. advantageous:--profit(-able).
